PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Lock movement initiation from chassis handle,564347,5.0,2.4.3.1.3.1.1,The system shall provide the possibility to lock all motorized chassis movements activated via chassis handle by pressing a dedicated hardware button at the handle panel.,Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-13,2022-02-10  10:23:05,Johannes Schmidt,,lock_movement_function,,,"Additionally, when the system is not operated for a certain time in standalone mode, it switches off (06S573383 in <XREF>561865</XREF>).",,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,"MCU,HICForceControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),User does not pay attention to obstacles in the movement path during transport movement (intentional),564115,2.8,2.4.4.1.1.1,"User does not pay attention to obstacles in the movement path during movement (intended):User reacts too slowly to obstaclesSystem drives too fast for user reactions (by design, normal condition) or unpredictably (technical failures)Miscommunication in the ORSimultaneous movements of other equipment and the systemBad overview, structures and equipment covered other equipment",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-11,2022-09-26  16:51:57,Klaus-Peter Fichtner (EXT),,,,,,HS_042,See general justifications in the introduction which apply here.,Headline,Basic,n.a.,none,n.a.,Not Determined,3-C,3-B,Cause,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,"Patient,User,System,Environment",S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,D,Med,C,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Collision avoidance in fast drive mode,564116,14.0,2.4.4.1.1.1.1,"The system shall detect the approximation of solid obstacles at critical collision areas of the system during fast drive mode (e. g. towards moving direction), e.g. by means of a distance sensor. When an approximation is detected, the system shall reduce the speed to OR (operating room) mode speed before an imminent collision takes place. During normal operation (e. g. stopping without collision / approximation, emergency stop activation without collision / approximation), the system shall not create false positive collision / approximation detection information. The functionality of the sensor shall be tested during boot and monitored during operation (e. g. checking and calibrating by regularly scanning known fixed mounted objects with differing fixed distances to the sensor). When an error in the sensor system is detected, the system shall go to operating room speed (deactivate fast drive mode) and indicate the error to the operator.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-11,2022-08-26  13:56:13,Johannes Schmidt,,collision_avoidance_fast_drive_mode,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,"MainU,MCU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Reference - Set speed values,562463,34.3,2.4.4.1.1.1.2,"The system sets the movement speeds according to different modes and control, see <XREF>569146</XREF>, and in order to meet the overtravel limits <XREF>562465</XREF> and to not exceed the speed limits <XREF>563486</XREF> in normal conditions.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:05:00,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,set_speed_values,,,IEC 60601-1; 9.2.2.6 Speed of movement(s)IEC 60601-2-54; 201.9.2.2.6 Speed of movement(s),,,Headline,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Reference - Set acceleration values,569215,10.2,2.4.4.1.1.1.3,"The acceleration of motorized movements under normal conditions is defined in <XREF>569146</XREF>.For maneuverability of the system, the set speed values are deemed to be sufficient. The acceleration (and deceleration) is however monitored for mechanical stability <XREF>563680</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-09-10,2021-08-07  15:04:59,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,set_acceleration_values,,,,,,Headline,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Additional restrictions for fast drive mode,564118,16.0,2.4.4.1.1.1.4,"The max. fast drive speed (set speed value) shall only be allowed in forward and backward direction under consideration of the speed limits <XREF>563486</XREF> and permissible centrifugal acceleration <XREF>563681</XREF>, and when initiated from the chassis force handle. Furthermore, fast drive mode shall only be allowed if the footswitch is disconnected. When the system is in fast drive mode, and movements are initiated from other movement controls than from the chassis handle, the system shall apply max. OR mode speed (set speed).",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-11,2022-09-22  13:54:55,Johannes Schmidt,,restrictions_fast_drive_mode,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Timeout for fast drive mode,564119,8.0,2.4.4.1.1.1.5,"After at most 300 seconds of chassis standstill in fast drive mode, there shall be a timeout deactivating the fast drive mode automatically.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-11,2022-02-17  10:33:56,Johannes Schmidt,,timeout_fast_drive_mode,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Safe activation fast drive mode,578309,8.0,2.4.4.1.1.4.1,"The fast drive mode shall be activated by two redundant paths. Note: Safety architecture C + P, see <XREF>561860</XREF> and <XREF>543971</XREF>. PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Check fast drive mode button state,571915,10.0,2.4.4.1.1.4.2,"The system shall check the status of both fast drive button signal paths during boot-up. When an active fast drive button signal path is detected, the fast drive mode shall be blocked and an error message shall be displayed until a deactivation and regular re-activation of both fast-drive release paths takes place.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-10-22,2022-09-29  14:48:23,Johannes Schmidt,,check_fast_drive_mode_button,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),"Unintentional activation of movement during startup (by operator, e. g. control element clamped, or by technical error)",563480,2.9,2.4.8.1.1.1,"Unintentional activation of movement during startup:Unintended activation of control element by the operator, e. g. control element is clampedErroneous activation of movement due to technical error, e. g. movement key is stuck",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-05,2022-08-16  14:35:17,Klaus-Peter Fichtner (EXT),,,,,,HS_042,See general justifications in the introduction which apply here. ,Headline,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,3-B,3-A,Cause,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,"Moving parts,use by unskilled/untrained personnel,slips, lapses and mistakes,Foreseeable misuse,Untrained users","Patient,User,Service Personnel,System,Environment",S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,C,Med,B,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Check movement release signal status at startup,562344,17.0,2.4.8.1.1.1.1,"The system shall check the status of both movement release signal paths at startup.When an active movement release signal path is detected, movements from the affected control (sharing one enable hardware line) shall be blocked and an error message shall be displayed, until a deactivation and regular re-activation of both movement release paths takes place.? Note 1: Safety architecture C + P, see <XREF>561860</XREF> and <XREF>543971</XREF>. For design constraints for single fault safety, see <XREF>578311</XREF>.  Note 2: The emergency stop of the affected control remains functional.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-06-17  08:58:10,Johannes Schmidt,,Check_AtStartUp_s1,,,"SFS (for all movement controls, and for all wired X-ray controls, but not for wireless footswitch no PM is involved)",,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Control elements protected against unintended movement or x-ray activation,562378,16.0,2.4.8.1.1.1.2,"The control elements shall be designed in such a manner that unintended movement or x-ray activation by the operator is prevented e.g.:- Joysticks are recessed and have an additional movement triggering switch- No locking of buttons in activated position possible- For the wireless and wired remote control, no function shall be activated when the component is dropped or put reversely on a flat surface (see also 60601-1 cl. 15.3.1).- At least control elements related to switching the system on/off, chassis movement initiation, brake control and x-ray release shall be recessed.- Handle for power assisted chassis movements shall have two switches / buttons / sensors which are physically separated.- The system shall only allow movement initiation from the handles if force is applied within 2 s timeout after the capacitive sensors are activated.Note: In case the timeout passes by without force being applied or when trying to reinitiate a movement after a temporary stop that exceeds the timeout, the operator needs to release the handles and start a new movement.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-08-23  11:44:21,Johannes Schmidt,,flat_control_elements,,,SFSIEC 60601-1; 9.2.3.1 Unintended movementIEC 60601-2-54; 201.9.2.3.1 Unintended movement,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,"HICForceControl,HICHandControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Continuous activation of movements with redundant activation paths,562377,17.0,2.4.8.1.1.1.3,"Motorized movement shall be possible only when two redundant signals provided by two independent paths are present (continuous activation), preventing unintended movement activation. When only one of two paths is activated, all motorized movements shall be stopped and inhibited for the respective control.?Note: Safety architecture C + P, see <XREF>561860</XREF> and <XREF>543971</XREF>.For design constraints for single fault safety, see <XREF>578311</XREF>. Further note: For network interfaces cyclic retriggering (cyclic messages within e.g. 150 ms) are seen as equivalent to continuous activation.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-09-27  11:39:18,Johannes Schmidt,,dead_mans_push_buttons,,,SFSIEC 60601-1; 9.2.3.1 Unintended movementIEC 60601-2-54; 201.9.2.3.1 Unintended movementIEC 60601-1; 9.2.2.5 Continuous activationIEC 60601-2-54; 201.9.2.2.5 Continuous activation,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,"HICSwitch,MCU,HICForceControl,HICHandControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Emergency stop at every point of motorized movement activation,562345,25.0,2.4.8.1.1.1.4,"Emergency stop shall be available at every point of motorized movement activation.Points of movement activation (control locations) are:- control panel at the FD cover- wireless hand control- wired hand control- Backside of Servo-Handle Chassis The emergency stop shall be designed according to IEC 60947-5-1 and IEC 60947-5-5.  When an emergency stop is activated, all motorized movements of the system except the motorized monitor height adjustment shall be stopped (e. g. stop category 1, thereof e. g. safe stop 1 function according to 61800-5-2) and inhibited until it is deactivated again. ?Note 1: Safety architecture C + P, see <XREF>561860</XREF> and <XREF>543971</XREF>.For design constraints for single fault safety, see <XREF>578311</XREF>.  Note 2: For behaviour regarding radiation, see <XREF>562135</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-06-17  08:59:20,Johannes Schmidt,,EmergencyStopMovement_s1,,,SFSIEC 60601-1; 9.2.4 Emergency stopping devicesIEC 60601-1; 9.2.2.4.4 Other RISK CONTROL measuresIEC 60601-1; 9.2.2.5 Continuous activationIEC 60601-2-54; 201.9.2.3.1 Unintended movementIEC 60601-2-54; 201.9.2.4.101 Controls,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,"MainU,MCU,HICForceControl,HICHandControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Self-test of protection module hardware,571864,4.1,2.4.8.1.1.2.1,"The protection module hardware shall execute a self-test of its safety relevant hardware at startup.When the test fails, all motorized movements shall remain inhibited.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-10-20,2021-08-07  15:04:52,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,self-test_protection_hardware,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Safe power supply of protection module hardware,578161,9.0,2.4.8.1.1.2.3,"The protection module hardware shall have a safe power supply: The over- / undervoltage protection shall be either redundantly implemented or be tested at startup. The voltage limits shall be defined according to the guaranteed working voltages of the hardware to ensure correct functionality. When the startup test fails or one of the over-/undervoltage protection detects an error, all motorized movements and radiation shall be inhibited.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2021-02-02,2022-06-28  14:38:04,Johannes Schmidt,,safe_power_supply_protection_hardware,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),General principles protective path,578307,22.1,2.4.8.1.1.2.4,"The following general principles for designing the protective path shall be considered:- The software of the protective path shall be developed according to software safety class C (IEC 62304).- Common causes (errors or environmental conditions that could affect C and P simultaneously) shall be considered and excluded by design:   ESD / transients (sufficient electrical isolation between P and C path signals), temperature out of specified limits, etc. For components which are connected to the protection module, especially the integration requirements of <XREF>580888</XREF> shall be considered.  Note 1: Safe power supply of P and the mechanical mounting of the encoders have already separate requirements <XREF>578161</XREF>, <XREF>578163</XREF>,<XREF>578173</XREF>. Note 2: For design contraints for single fault safety, see <XREF>578311</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2021-02-05,2022-08-22  15:35:01,Johannes Schmidt,,general_principles_protective_path,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,empty,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,"HICSwitch,MainU,MCU,HICForceControl,HICHandControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),"X-ray chain is not functional (e. g. communication error, hardware error)",569275,2.3,2.4.8.1.2.1,,Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-09-15,2022-09-26  16:58:03,Klaus-Peter Fichtner (EXT),,,,,,HS_091,See general justifications in the introduction which apply here.,Headline,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,2-B,2-A,Cause,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,"Moving parts,use by unskilled/untrained personnel,slips, lapses and mistakes,Foreseeable misuse,Untrained users",Patient,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,D,Low,C,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),X-ray chain selftest at startup,564352,7.11,2.4.8.1.2.1.1,"The system shall perform a cross-component self-test of the X-ray chain at startup of the system:HV_trigger, idexi line from FLC (IC) to Generator interface and HV_ON with the involved subsystems Xgen, GenIF, FLC, XCU.All involved subsystems / components shall report if the test was successful or not. If the test was not successful, a message shall be displayed to the operator (no X-ray blocking).Remark: HW error in HV_Trigger, HV_On then detectable before X-ray release, cross-component selftest (and that DEXI is not sent to generator due to network configuration issue)",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-13,2022-02-17  13:18:04,Johannes Schmidt,,x-ray_chain_selftest_startup,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VxFUTURE,"FLC,MCU,XCU,XGen",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),"Delayed boot-up or restart time to recover system functions (e. g. after error, SW freeze)",569297,1.3,2.4.8.1.2.2,,Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-09-15,2022-09-26  16:58:03,Klaus-Peter Fichtner (EXT),,,,,,HS_091,See general justifications in the introduction which apply here.,Headline,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,2-B,2-A,Cause,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,"Moving parts,use by unskilled/untrained personnel,slips, lapses and mistakes,Foreseeable misuse,Untrained users",Patient,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,D,Low,C,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Recovery management,568860,13.0,2.4.8.1.2.2.1,"The following time restrictions shall be met for recovery management (this is also valid for EMC immunity testing): * Time from initiating a shut down via reset button, booting the system again, until X-ray ready: 120 s?  * Time from initiating a shut down via reset button, until the previous settings are restored again (this includes registering a patient, set loading parameters (kV, mA, p/s), move the system from angular 0° to an exemplary previously stored position of angular 180°): 4 min  * Time from initiating a regular shut down via off button, booting the system again, until X-ray ready: 4 min  * Time from power supply interruption, booting the system again, until X-ray ready: 120 sNote: Due to the limited time to recover all system functions, no emergency radiography mode needs to be provided.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-09-02,2022-02-28  11:18:14,Johannes Schmidt,,recovery_management,,,IEC 60601-2-43; cl. 201.4.102,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,"FLC,MCU,PowerU,XCU,XGen",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),User Manual: Electromagnetic fields Chassis,597005,9.1,2.4.10.1.3.1.2,"CAUTION Cause: The chassis contains electromagnetic components with high magnetic near fields (Drives and brakes of angular and orbital axes, chassis wheels), which might have an influence on implant devices such as cardiac pacemakers. Possible consequences: Hazards on people with implants due to electromagnetic disturbances. Remedy: If you have active implanted cardiac devices keep a distance of >10 cm to the above mentioned components.",InWork,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Johannes Schmidt,,,2022-06-27,2022-10-07  09:53:31,Johannes Schmidt,,docUser_electromagnetic_fields,,,IEC 60601-1: cl. 7.2.13,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Service Doc: Electromagnetic fields Chassis,597007,4.0,2.4.10.1.3.1.3,"CAUTION in Service Manual Cause: The chassis contains electromagnetic components with high magnetic near fields (Drives and brakes of angular and orbital axes, chassis wheels), which might have an influence on implant devices such as cardiac pacemakers. Possible consequences: Hazards on people with implants due to electromagnetic disturbances. Remedy: If you have active implanted cardiac devices keep a distance of >10 cm to the above mentioned components.",Approved,Medium,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Johannes Schmidt,,,2022-06-27,2022-06-27  13:56:30,Johannes Schmidt,,docServ_electromagnetic_fields,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,Subsystem Integration Test,EXPORT,Service Documentation,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,Service Personnel,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Biocompatible material,597019,7.7,2.4.10.1.4.1.1,"The clinical user and the service personnel get in regular hand skin contact with the following components of the system: AccesS (RCP cart, Keyboard, Mouse), DSmonS (Monitor), GridS, HICSwitch, HICTouchCon, MainU (Covers), TrolleyU (Covers, X10 cable and plug), HICForceControl, HICHandControl, These components shall be made out of biocompatible material or at least it shall be shown that the utilized material is in common use for regular consumer products or that there is an established history of safe use in a clinical environment, e.g. from previous CIOS systems.",Approved,Medium,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Johannes Schmidt,,,2022-06-27,2022-08-09  15:19:46,Nils Naarmann,,biocompatible_material,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,Component Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,"AccesS,DSMonS,GridS,HICSwitch,HICTouchCon,MainU,TrolleyU,HICForceControl,HICHandControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Prerequisites for fast drive mode,563488,19.0,2.4.12.1.1.1.5,"Prerequisites for fast drive mode: Vertical axle shall be in the max. downwards position and the C-arm in the upright position (orbital/angular = 0° +/- 5° tolerance). The correct position shall be detected single fault safe. The trolley-chassis cable shall be disconnected from the main unit.Note: Safety architecture C + P, see <XREF>561860</XREF> and <XREF>543971</XREF>.For design constraints for single fault safety, see <XREF>578311</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-05,2022-06-17  09:00:08,Johannes Schmidt,,prerequisites_fast_drive,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,"MainU,MCU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Collision detection via position change of other axles,571916,9.0,2.4.12.1.1.1.8,"Position changes of motorized axles which are not used for motorized movements shall be detected (although the brakes of orb. and ang. axles e. g. are activated each during other motorized movements, they can be overridden manually).In case a non-expected position change of more than +/- 5° is detected, all motorized movements shall stop.Hint: The system may be configured to stop at even lower thresholds < 5°.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-10-22,2022-09-12  11:34:14,Johannes Schmidt,,collision_detection_other_axles,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,"MainU,MCU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Warning - General risk of collisions,563493,5.2,2.4.12.1.1.1.9,"WARNINGCause: System movements.Risk: Risk of collision, risk of injury to patient or operator, risk of damage to the system or other equipment.Remedy: Ensure that movements are released only if neither the operator, the patient, other persons or other equipment cannot be endangered.Always pay attention to possible collisions during movements.Make sure that nobody is standing inside the danger area.Ensure that collision sensors of the system are not covered by any accessories e.g., drape fixtures,  which would unintentionally activate or prevent activation of the collision detection system.Remove any objects from collision area, e.g. injector or infusion stand.Body penetrating objects introduced in the patient (e.g. catheter, biopsy / kyphoplasty needle) must not be actuated by system movements.Special care is required when the system has already detected a collision situation.Use the emergency stop if required.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-05,2022-10-11  11:22:58,Johannes Schmidt,,um_risk_collision_general,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Positioning validity of motorized axes,571870,16.5,2.4.12.1.1.2.2,"During every movement in orbital or in angular direction, a comparison between their protective position sensors and their position sensors used by the control system shall be executed. When an error is detected, motorized movements of the affected axle shall be inhibited. Note1: This replaces a regular self-test at startup. This is also required since the protective position sensors do not provide safe positions according to SIL2 or higher. Note2:The movement stop affects all system drives. Movements from the not affected drive can be initiated directly again.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-10-20,2022-08-19  10:59:28,Rudolf Siebenhaar,,Positioning_validity_of_motorized_axes,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,"MainU,MCU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Independent power supply of protective position sensors,578163,12.1,2.4.12.1.1.2.3,"The protective position sensors (orbital, angular and for mecanum wheels) shall have an independent power supply from the other position sensors. Hint: The power supply for one position sensor shall be provided by the c-path, the power supply of the other position sensor shall be provided by p-path.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2021-02-02,2022-10-05  13:38:12,Peter Hefter,,independent_power_supply_protective_position_sensors,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,NEW,empty,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,MainU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Self-test of the collision sensors,571873,14.0,2.4.12.1.1.3.2,"The functionality of the collision sensors shall be tested at startup and continuously during operation (no connection). When an error in the collision detection system is detected, the system shall stop all motorized movements and show an error message to the operator. Subsequent movements are allowed with collision mode speed. For detailed behaviour, see collision detection requirements <XREF>563490</XREF> and <XREF>563719</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-10-20,2022-07-28  09:21:57,Johannes Schmidt,,self-test_collision_sensors,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Warning - Check collision sensors,563492,4.0,2.4.12.1.1.3.4,"WARNINGCause: Undetected failure of the collision sensors.Risk: Risk of collision, risk of injury to patient or operator, risk of damage to the system or other equipment.Remedy: Perform a daily check of the collision sensors at the chassis and the C-arm according to the steps below. PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),System acceleration and deceleration limits,563680,10.0,2.4.12.1.1.8.1,"The system shall limit the acceleration and deceleration so that tipping over of the system is prevented. In case the acceleration / deceleration threshold is exceeded, the system shall stop all motorized movements.?Note: Safety architecture C + P, see <XREF>561860</XREF> and <XREF>543971</XREF>.For design constraints for single fault safety, see <XREF>578311</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-07,2022-06-17  09:00:53,Johannes Schmidt,,limit_acceleration_deceleration,,,SFS,#Haz07,"Risk control measures are in place and reduce the risk as far as possible without adversely affecting the benefit-risk-ratio. Compliance to applicable regulations, technical standards and other design requirements limits the probability of occurrence of the scenario. Service activities ensure to maintain the integrity of the design and detect degradations. The operator manual warns to take care of potential crushing zones and requires the appropriate carefullness when releasing system movements, especially when additional parts are mounted at the C-arm, e. g. for navigation. Additional mitigations are not deemed to further reduce or prevent the risk of collision. Post market surveillance and complaint handling are in place to identify specific issues.",Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,2-C,2-B,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User,System",S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,E,Low,D,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Limit system centrifugal acceleration,563681,9.0,2.4.12.1.1.8.2,"The system shall limit the maximum permissible centrifugal acceleration so that tipping over of the system is prevented.?Note: Safety architecture C + P, see <XREF>561860</XREF> and <XREF>543971</XREF>.For design constraints for single fault safety, see <XREF>578311</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-07,2022-06-17  09:01:33,Johannes Schmidt,,limit_centrifugal_accelleration,,,SFS,#Haz07,"Risk control measures are in place and reduce the risk as far as possible without adversely affecting the benefit-risk-ratio. Compliance to applicable regulations, technical standards and other design requirements limits the probability of occurrence of the scenario. Service activities ensure to maintain the integrity of the design and detect degradations. The operator manual warns to take care of potential crushing zones and requires the appropriate carefullness when releasing system movements, especially when additional parts are mounted at the C-arm, e. g. for navigation. Additional mitigations are not deemed to further reduce or prevent the risk of collision. Post market surveillance and complaint handling are in place to identify specific issues.",Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,2-C,2-B,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User,System",S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,E,Low,D,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Behaviour in collision,563719,21.0,2.4.12.1.1.11.1,"When the operator wants to move the system out of a collision (all movements have been stopped), the system shall behave as follows:Movements shall only be possible with reduced speed, after new activation of movement. The reduced speed is maintained as long as the movement is activated (and not as long as collision sensor is activated, no ""automatic"" acceleration). When the movement is stopped, and re-initiated and the collision state has been removed, the subsequent movement shall be performed normally again. In case additional collision sensor are activated, the system shall also behave as described above (stop, reduced speed after new movement activation, check real system position changes). Note: Safety architecture C + P, see <XREF>561860</XREF> and <XREF>543971</XREF>.For design constraints for single fault safety, see <XREF>578311</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-07,2022-06-17  09:02:10,Johannes Schmidt,,behaviour_collision,,,SFSFollow-up hazard: 06H563718,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Torque limits mecanum,563722,14.0,2.4.12.1.1.11.2,"The system shall restrict the torque of the mecanum drives when collision detection is active. If a torque exceeding the limit is detected, the mecanum drives shall stop. Note: Safety architecture C + P, see <XREF>561860</XREF> and <XREF>543971</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-07,2022-06-18  09:56:34,Johannes Schmidt,,torque_limits_mecanum,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,empty,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,"MainU,MCU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Safe stop motorized movements,563749,16.0,2.4.12.1.1.14.2,"The braking process (regular release of move enable or quickstop) shall be monitored. If the system detects an increased delay in reaction or a wrong braking ramp, the system shall stop, e. g. by implementing a safe stop 2 function according to IEC 60204-1 or equivalent.The fast braking process (quickstop) shall be implemented single fault safe. When the system detects an increased delay in reaction or a wrong braking ramp, the system shall stop, e. g. by implementing a safe stop 2 function according to IEC 60204-1 or equivalent. Note: Safety architecture C + P, see <XREF>561860</XREF> and <XREF>543971</XREF>.For design constraints for single fault safety, see <XREF>578311</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-07,2022-09-29  15:11:43,Johannes Schmidt,,safe_stop_motorized_movements,,,"SFS(The implementation is two stage: 1. PM tries to trigger QS at the motorcontroller, 2. PM triggers STO and brakes.)",,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,"MainU,MCU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Reference - System acceleration and deceleration limits,563727,2.3,2.4.12.1.2.1.1,<XREF>563680</XREF>,Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-07,2022-05-30  09:45:43,Johannes Schmidt,,limit_acceleration_deceleration,,,,#Haz07,"Risk control measures are in place and reduce the risk as far as possible without adversely affecting the benefit-risk-ratio. Compliance to applicable regulations, technical standards and other design requirements limits the probability of occurrence of the scenario. Service activities ensure to maintain the integrity of the design and detect degradations. The operator manual warns to take care of potential crushing zones and requires the appropriate carefullness when releasing system movements, especially when additional parts are mounted at the C-arm, e. g. for navigation. Additional mitigations are not deemed to further reduce or prevent the risk of collision. Post market surveillance and complaint handling are in place to identify specific issues.",Headline,Basic,n.a.,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,E,Low,D,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Prevent incorrect movement execution - mecanum,563729,9.0,2.4.12.1.2.1.3,"The system shall check if the current mecanum drive information is a valid mecanum movement (fulfill the mecanum equations). PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Prevent tip over by mechanical design,563730,14.1,2.4.12.1.2.1.4,"System shall not tip over by mechanical design in the following normal and fault conditions:- emergency stop during max. transport speed in transport position- emergency stop during curve movement in the worst case axle positions and movement speed- system is stopped with max. permissible external additional components mounted in the worst case axle positions and OR speed- one mecanum drive blocks completely during movement in the worst case axle position and movement speed- all mecanum drives block completely during movement (brakes activated) in the worst case axle position and movement speed- emergency stop at OR speed and inclined surface of 7° (no transport mode speed) Note:During normal stopping (releasing movement control element), the system shall not lift at one side at all.During other stopping scenarios, it is allowed that the rear mecanum wheels of the system lift temporarily. The short duration of the lifting combined with the expected position of the operator with respect to the possible trapping zone prevent a crushing of the operator foot with the system during this scenario.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-07,2022-06-01  09:23:07,Johannes Schmidt,,prevent_tipover_bydesign,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,MainU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,E,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Warning - Weight limit for additionally mounted components,563735,5.4,2.4.12.1.2.4.2,"WARNINGCause: Additional components are attached to the C-arm.Possible consequences: System movements behave differently, C-arm may be counterbalanced, risk of crushing or tipping over is increased.Remedy: Only mount approved components to the C-arm. Ensure that the floor is free of obstacles and is not slippery.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-07,2021-08-07  15:04:56,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,um_weight_limit_additional_components,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,empty,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Warning - Inclined surface restriction,578343,11.3,2.4.12.1.2.4.4,"WARNINGCause: System is moved on a steep ramp, over a step or uneven ground. Possible consequences: System movements behave differently. The C-arm may be counterbalanced or collide with the floor. Risk of crushing or tipping over is increased.Remedy: The system is designed for steps of max. 2 cm and ramp pitches of max. 5° when in transport position. If moving on steeper ramps the lifting column of the C-arm needs to be raised enough to avoid collision with the floor and the system must be moved with care. Note, do not raise the lifting column unnecessarily high because the risk of tipping over is increased.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2021-02-08,2022-06-15  18:00:27,Johannes Schmidt,,um_steep_ramp,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,empty,empty,Measure,empty,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Warning - Service instruction for inclined surfaces,596712,4.1,2.4.12.1.2.4.5,"Warning - Service Instruction for inclined surfaces WARNINGCause: ???????? System is moved on a steep ramp, over a step or uneven ground.Possible consequences: ??System movements behave differently. The C-arm may be counterbalanced or collide with the floor. Risk of crushing or tipping over is increased.Remedy: ????????The system is designed for steps of max. 2 cm and ramps of max. 7°. Note, when the system is in transport position ramp pitches of max. 5° are possible. If moving on steeper ramps the lifting column of the C-arm needs to be raised enough to avoid collision with the floor and the system must be moved with care. Do not raise the lifting column unnecessarily high because the risk of tipping over is increased.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Johannes Schmidt,,,2022-05-24,2022-09-29  15:33:36,Johannes Schmidt,,serv_inclined_surfaces,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,Service Documentation,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,Service Personnel,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Only one active movement control element at a time,563634,7.0,2.4.12.1.3.1.1,"The system shall be designed in such a way that if a control element (e.g., button or handle) is actively used for a specific movement, operation of any movement from a different control element is inhibited until the active control element is deactivated. Note:- Emergency stops and in particular collision sensors are not affected and always overrule the action of control elements if activated.- In case a movement has been terminated e.g. by means of a collision, a new movement can be initiated from a different control device even if the control element that triggered the initial movement is still activated, e.g. a still pressed button or touched handle.- Initiating more than one movement by pressing more than one button simultaneously at the same device shall also not be possible.- Other system functionalities apart from system movements such as activating the laser light shall not be affected by this requirement and can be performed simultaneously during movements.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-06,2022-09-23  09:17:21,Johannes Schmidt,,only_one_active_control_element,,,Machinery directive (EHSR); 1.2.2,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),No movement take over across controls,569307,3.3,2.4.12.1.3.1.3,"When another control button is activated (not controlling the movement) while the movement controlled by another control button is stopped, the movement shall be stopped until a deactivation and reactivation of the movement command took place.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-09-17,2021-08-07  15:04:27,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,no_movement_takeover_across_controls,,,Machinery directive (EHSR); 1.2.2,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Redundant signals from same control button,569308,5.7,2.4.12.1.3.1.4,Only movement release signal pairs from the same control button or from control buttons which share one enable line shall trigger movements.Note: Chassis handle panel transport position button and chassis handles share the enable line.,Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-09-17,2021-12-23  14:27:48,Johannes Schmidt,,movement_signals_same_control_button,,,Machinery directive (EHSR); 1.2.2,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),System moves in wrong direction due to operating error (intentional movement): mix-up of directions or buttons etc.,563647,2.8,2.4.12.1.3.2,System moves in wrong direction due to operating error (intentional movement):User mixes up directions of a joystickUser mixes up buttonsFD force handle: Operator has unintentionally locked an electro-magnetic brake or has locked the wrong brake (this locks the movement direction when movements are initiated via FD handle),Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-06,2022-09-26  17:05:43,Klaus-Peter Fichtner (EXT),,,,,,HS_041,See general justifications in the introduction which apply here.,Headline,Basic,n.a.,none,n.a.,Not Determined,2-D,2-B,Cause,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,Moving parts,"Patient,User,Service Personnel",S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,F,Low,D,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Movement preview for position movements,563648,13.0,2.4.12.1.3.2.1,"For all position movements, the system shall have an optical indication of the planned system movement (movement preview), as soon as the position movement is selected (not initiated) (e.g. pictogram, color marking displaying the difference between the current pose and the target pose with respect to the system orientation).?Exceptions: During image acquisition in any mode no preview is required. The movement preview shall be shown after the image acquisition has finished. For movement to the transport and 0/0 position, no preview is required.?Note 1: The operator has the possibility to check the subsequent movement.?Note 2: Position movements are e. g. position storage, park & return, default positions.?Note 3: Only a preview is required. The preview is required before start of movement. During movement, no display is required (functionally it might be reasonable though in order to see whether the desired position has been reached, at least towards the end of the movement sequence), since the operator observes the mechanical movement of the system.",Approved,Unassigned,Klaus-Peter Fichtner (EXT),Klaus-Peter,Fichtner (EXT),Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-06,2022-06-18  09:57:55,Johannes Schmidt,,movement_preview,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,Moving parts,,S1M,VB10,"FLC,MCU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Warning - Collisions during position movements without test run,563650,6.0,2.4.12.1.3.2.2,"WARNINGCause: Movement to a predefined position.Risk: Risk of collision, risk of injury to patient or operator, risk of damage to the system or other equipment.Remedy: Prior to initiating a movement to a predefined position, check the planned movement path via the movement preview and ensure that the path is free of any obstacles.Ensure that the patient is fixated at the table and that the table is positioned correctly (tilt etc.). Observe the movement continuously.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-06,2022-01-14  09:09:45,Johannes Schmidt,,um_collisions_position_movements,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,Moving parts,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Orientation indication for remote movement controls,563651,3.0,2.4.12.1.3.2.3,"For control modules where the operator can switch his / her orientation towards the system, the affected control shall indicate the currently selected location of the operator in relation to the system movements.For controls or buttons which have several functions, it shall be clearly indicated to the operator, which function is currently selected. Note: The operator has the possibility to check the subsequent movement.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-06,2021-09-03  09:50:15,Judith Welzel,,orientation_indication_remote_controls,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,Moving parts,,S1M,VB10,"MCU,HICHandControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Deactivate whole chassis handle when error in movement activation is detected,563672,3.0,2.4.12.1.3.3.1,"When an error in the movement activation circuit in one side of the chassis handle is detected, movement activation from the whole chassis handle shall be inhibited. Note: This is checked during startup.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-07,2022-09-26  08:21:14,Johannes Schmidt,,deactivate_chassis_handle,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,Moving parts,,S1M,VB10,"MCU,HICForceControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Plausibility check for sensors in movement control elements,563673,10.4,2.4.12.1.3.3.2,"The system shall permanently check the plausibility of analogue sensor outputs for movement control of the force handle sensors and the hand control joystick during movement activation. When a significant implausible deviation is detected, movement initiated from this control location shall be stopped and inhibited and an error message shall be shown as long as the malfunction is present.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-07,2022-03-02  10:38:10,Ingo Hollenborg,,check_plausibility_sensors,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,Moving parts,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),"System does not move according to control parameters, does not follow the planned movement path due to external factors",563683,2.8,2.4.12.1.3.4,"System does not move according to control parameters, does not follow the planned movement path due to external factors (while maintaining speed limits etc.):Grip is suddenly removed, fluids on the floor, partiallyObstacles on the floor: cables,...Uneven floorDoorsteps in the waySystem moves onto an inclined planeSlip of one or more wheels (correct speeds and directions of all drives,  contamination of the wheels…), resulting movement direction of system is not correctAdditional components / accessories are mounted on the system",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-07,2022-09-26  17:05:44,Klaus-Peter Fichtner (EXT),,,,,,HS_041,See general justifications in the introduction which apply here.,Headline,Basic,n.a.,none,n.a.,Not Determined,2-C,2-B,Cause,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,Moving parts,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,D,Low,C,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Main Unit movement shock detection,563684,10.0,2.4.12.1.3.4.1,"The system shall check the movement for significant shocks.If a significant shock is detected, motorized movements shall be stopped (but not inhibited) and an appropriate error message shall be displayed?to the user, so that the user can decide to keep or delete stored positions.?This is relevant in cases when the collision detection of the system has not been activated.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-07,2022-08-24  10:59:30,Johannes Schmidt,,main_unit_movement_shock_detection,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,Moving parts,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Cable deflectors and wheel protection,563689,5.1,2.4.12.1.3.4.6,"The wheels shall be equipped with cable deflectors and cover at the upper side to prevent entanglement of external objects in the wheels and prevent external mechanical influence (cables, other disturbing parts which could get caught in the wheels).",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-07,2021-08-07  15:04:32,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,cable_deflectors,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,MainU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Warning - EMC disturbances of other equipment,562061,2.7,2.4.12.1.7.1.2,"Note: Warning that, even when the system complies with 60601-1-2, other interferences could result in functional disturbances:WARNINGCause: The electromagnetic radiation of the system may cause interference.Risk: This interference may disturb or disrupt the operation of nearby equipment.Remedy:- Examinations involving external equipment require that there are healthcare professionals present, who are trained for managing the malfunctions of these external equipment and associated emergency situations.- In case of disturbances in external equipment operation, try to re-orient or re-locate these.- To prevent such disturbances, it may be necessary to shield the external equipment/location.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:04:33,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,docUser_note_uncommon_system_behavior,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Prevent tension at trolley-chassis cable,563740,30.0,2.4.12.1.9.1.1,"The system shall detect any tensile load on the trolley-chassis cable. When a hazardous tensile load is detected, motorized chassis movements shall be stopped before any damage to the system or any influence on the movement trajectory occurs. Subsequent movements may only be initiated with collision speed <XREF>576777</XREF>. At the same time, the torque supervision <XREF>563722</XREF> shall be applied.An appropriate message or indication shall be displayed to the operator.?Note 1: Safety architecture C + P, see <XREF>561860</XREF> and <XREF>543971</XREF>.For design constraints for single fault safety, see <XREF>578311</XREF>. Note 2: When the trolley is moved (manually always), there is direct feedback to the operator who pushes or pulls the trolley, so that it is not likely that any damage occurs due to that, also based on the field information based on previous systems.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-07,2022-06-17  09:04:18,Johannes Schmidt,,prevent_tension_tc_cable,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,Moving parts,,S1M,VB10,"MainU,MCU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Behaviour with activated trolley-chassis cable tension detection,576777,16.0,2.4.12.1.9.1.2,"With activated trolley-chassis cable tension detection (that means after stopping and new movement initiation), the system shall only allow motorized chassis movements with reduced speed. The behaviour shall be the same as in a collision detection situation.<XREF>563490</XREF> Note: In case the operator cannot relieve the tension with motorized movements, he / she can unplug the cable, move the cable, untangle the cable or the setup, or move the trolley.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2021-01-18,2022-02-09  13:43:05,Johannes Schmidt,,behaviour_tension_detection_tc_cable,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,Moving parts,,S1M,VB10,"MainU,MCU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Self-test trolley-chassis cable tension detection,576779,10.0,2.4.12.1.9.2.1,The system shall perform a self-test of the trolley-chassis cable tension detection as long as the cable is plugged in.If an error is detected the behavior shall be the same as if cable tension is detected (see <XREF>576777</XREF> and <XREF>563740</XREF>).,Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2021-01-18,2022-02-24  13:18:50,Johannes Schmidt,,self-test_tension_detection_tc_cable,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,Moving parts,,S1M,VB10,"MainU,MCU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),No measure required,576794,4.2,2.4.12.1.12.1.1,"IEC 60601-2-54, clause 203.9 requires a minimum focal spot to skin distance (aka next surface which mechanically prevents that the operator cannot place any anatomy closer to the X-ray source, e. g. X-ray window) of 200 mm.Theoretically, it is possible that the anatomy is positioned directly on the X-ray window so that the focal spot to skin distance would be violated. However, this is not considered as reasonably foreseeable sequence of events. Therefore, it is concluded, that no significant risk is related to the design. No additional measures are required and the design is acceptable.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2021-01-20,2021-08-07  15:04:33,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,,,,IEC 60601-2-54 cl. 203.9,,,Headline,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Optical indication of system and hand controls - collision,600715,3.0,2.4.12.2.1.1.4,"In Service Documentation?WARNINGCause: Movement released from a remote hand control in another roomPossible Consequences: Collision of system with persons or objectRemedy: Before performing any service activities with the remote hand control, check that the remote hand control belongs to the system and check that the indicating label is in place and properly visible.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Johannes Schmidt,,,2022-09-20,2022-09-20  11:12:32,Johannes Schmidt,,docServ_optical_indication_wireless_collision,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,Service Documentation,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Labeling wireless hand control - collision,600716,4.0,2.4.12.2.1.1.5,"WARNINGCause: Movement released from a remote hand control in another roomPossible Consequences: Collision of system with persons or objectRemedy: As part of the system installation, the wireless hand control is labeled according to which system it belongs to.When utilizing the wireless hand control, check that it belongs to the system according to the indicating labels and ensure there is visual contact with the system.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Johannes Schmidt,,,2022-09-20,2022-09-21  08:21:25,Johannes Schmidt,,docUser_labeling_wireless_hand_control_collision,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Emergency stop on the wireless or wired hand control is not functional during a hazardous situation,564237,6.1,2.4.12.2.1.3,"(when this emergency stop is activated by the operator) due to: Wireless hand control loses RF link, e. g. person takes hand control and walks away.Wired hand control non-functional or unplugged",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-12,2022-09-26  16:53:43,Klaus-Peter Fichtner (EXT),,,,,,HS_042,See general justifications in the introduction which apply here.,Headline,Basic,n.a.,none,n.a.,Not Determined,3-B,3-A,Cause,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,Moving parts,"Patient,User,Service Personnel,System,Environment",S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,C,Med,B,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Deactivate movement and radiation at wireless hand control receiver,564238,13.1,2.4.12.2.1.3.1,"The movement and radiation request shall be deactivated at the wireless hand control receiver, when the receiver looses its connection to the sender or when the communication is disturbed (independent of a potential running movement or radiation initiated from this control).If the wireless hand control receiver becomes non-functional, movement and radiation shall be deactivated from this control.In case an emergency stop has been activated before connection loss, it shall remain activated by the receiver.?Note: Safety architecture ""mixed"", see <XREF>561860</XREF> and <XREF>543971</XREF>. For design constraints for single fault safety, see <XREF>578311</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-12,2022-10-05  17:01:49,Peter Hefter,,deactivate_movement_radiation_wireless,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,"MCU,HICHandControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Deactivate movement and radiation at wired hand control,595749,2.4,2.4.12.2.1.3.2,"If the wired hand control is disconnected or becomes non-functional, movement and radiation shall be deactivated from this control.In case an emergency stop has been activated before unplugging or non-functionality of the wired hand control, it shall remain activated.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Johannes Schmidt,,,2022-03-31,2022-04-06  09:25:01,Ingo Hollenborg,,deactivate_movement_radiation_wired_HC,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,"MCU,HICHandControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Indication of e-stop functionality,564239,11.1,2.4.12.2.1.3.3,"The system shall indicate on the wireless hand control and on the user interface (if available, not available in battery mode) if the emergency stop of the wireless hand control is functional.It is acceptable if the wireless hand control uses e.g., a blinking LED for displaying the functionality. Note, there are two independent time outs, one for the hand control (for detecting the connection status and indicating it) and one at the receiver (for detecting the connection status and indicating it on system side).",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-12,2022-09-26  11:51:48,Johannes Schmidt,,indicate_e-stop_functionality_wireless,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,"MCU,HICHandControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),User message about non-functional wireless hand control and instruction to put it in the drawer,571957,2.17,2.4.12.2.1.3.4,"A message shall be displayed when the wireless hand control becomes non-functional or connection gets lost which shall instruct the operator to put the control into the drawer, and which shall be confirmed by the operator.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-11-06,2022-04-06  09:25:00,Ingo Hollenborg,,message_wireless_control_drawer,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,"MCU,HICHandControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),User message if wired hand control is non-functional,595744,3.3,2.4.12.2.1.3.5,A message shall be displayed when the wired hand control is non-functional and shall instruct the operator to put the wired hand control away. The message shall be confirmed by the operator.,Approved,Unassigned,Klaus-Peter Fichtner (EXT),Klaus-Peter,Fichtner (EXT),Johannes Schmidt,,,2022-03-31,2022-04-25  14:52:10,Peter Hefter,,message_wired_control_removal,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,"MCU,HICHandControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Safe wireless transfer of safety relevant information,564349,8.1,2.4.12.2.1.8.1,"The transfer of safety relevant movement and radiation signals / information from wireless remote controls shall be safe and protected against transmission errors (ensure integrity of packets including sequence).When an integrity error is detected, the movement and radiation enable shall be deactivated at the wireless hand control receiver (independent of a potential running movement or radiation initiated from this control).In case an emergency stop has been activated when the error is detected, it shall remain activated by the receiver.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-13,2021-08-07  15:04:55,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,safe_wireless_transfer,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,HICHandControl,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Self-test safe wireless transfer components,576771,11.2,2.4.12.2.1.9.1,"A self-test of the components required for protection mechanisms for safe wireless transfer shall be performed at system startup. This includes the protection mechanism of the receiver as well. In case components cannot be self-tested, the component shall be implemented redundantly. Note: For system reaction see <XREF>564351</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2021-01-15,2022-06-29  14:53:57,Johannes Schmidt,,self-test_safe_wireless_transfer,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,HICHandControl,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1;Current Baseline;06H_Risk_Analysis (06H);Safe power supply for safe wireless transfer components;578173;5.2;2.4.12.2.1.9.2;The components required for protection mechanisms for safe wireless transfer shall have a safe power supply: The over- / undervoltage protection shall be either redundantly implemented or be tested at startup. The voltage limits shall be defined according to the guaranteed working voltages of the hardware to ensure correct functionality. Note: For system reaction see <XREF>564351</XREF>.;Approved;Unassigned;Judith Welzel;Judith;Welzel;Judith Welzel;;;2021-02-02;2022-06-29  14:58:47;Johannes Schmidt;;safe_power_supply_wireless_hand_control;;;SFS;;;Requirement;Basic;System Integration Test;none;n.a.;Not Determined;Not determined;Not determined;Measure;Accepted;NotDetermined;NotDetermined;NotDetermined;NotDetermined;No;None;;;S1M;VB10;HICHandControl;;;;;;;;;;;;;NotDetermined;;;;

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Block movement when controls connecting,568781,4.0,2.4.12.2.1.12.1,"The system shall check the status of both movement release signal paths when controls are connected to the system.If an active movement release signal path is detected at hot plug, movements from the affected control (sharing one enable hardware line) shall be blocked and an error message shall be displayed, until a deactivation and regular re-activation of both movement release paths take place.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-31,2022-02-24  13:23:16,Johannes Schmidt,,check_movement_release_AtHotPlug_s1,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,N.A.,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Prevent unintended activation of e-stop,564244,4.8,2.4.12.2.3.4.1,"The emergency stops shall be protected against unintended activation (for the wired and wireless remote control e. g. mounting within a recessed surface of the surrounding control, but no closed mechanical shroud; for other emergency stops e. g. mounted away from areas which are foreseeably unintentionally touched etc.).",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-12,2021-08-07  15:04:59,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,protection_unintended_activation_e-stop,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,"MainU,HICForceControl,HICHandControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Indication of e-stop activation and location,564245,5.0,2.4.12.2.3.4.2,"When an emergency stop is activated, the system shall indicate that an emergency stop is activated and at which location.In battery mode it is acceptable, that only the activation state of emergency stop is indicated, and not the location.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-12,2022-07-27  09:10:13,Johannes Schmidt,,indication_activated_e-stop,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,"MCU,HICForceControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),No additional measure required,591781,3.2,2.4.12.2.3.5.1,"When the wireless hand control comes into wireless range again or becomes functional again after being out of the range or non-functional, the wireless hand control is not accepted as a valid control when the emergency stop is activated at that time due to regulatory reasons.This prevents that an ongoing movement is interrupted by an unintentional emergency stop activation while the wireless hand control is out of reach or not functional (emergency stop pressed when control is carried in the pocket of a coat, or when the batteries are exchanged etc.).",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2021-09-02,2021-09-02  14:53:51,Judith Welzel,,,,,,,,Headline,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,"MainU,HICForceControl,HICHandControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Alternative deactivation of emergency stop - hand control,564251,23.0,2.4.12.2.4.1.2,"There shall be an alternative safe way to deactivate an emergency stop of the wireless and the wired hand control with a deliberate action (two subsequent actions) by the operator.For the wireless hand control: Only if the hand control connection is lost with an activated e-stop by this control: After the connection loss, an activation and deactivation must take place at another emergency stop.For the wired hand control: Only if the wired hand control functionality is lost with an activated e-stop by this control: Unplugging the wired hand control and thereafter activating and deactivating another emergency stop.Note 1: The single actions of unplugging the wired hand control or putting the wireless hand control in the drawer shall not deactivate the emergency stop.If a connection is re-established and the e-stop has been released in the meanwhile at another device, the e-stop shall not be present. If the e-stop has not been released in the meanwhile at another device, then the e-stop shall remain present until resolved.  Note 2: This is deemed to sufficiently prevent the scenario, that an e-stop is deactivated unintentionally when e. g. two operators activate their e-stops nearly simultaneously (followed by a deactivation of the second one), since it is deemed very unlikely that the sequence connection loss, and e-stop already is activated, another e-stop is activated for another purpose or unintentionally than to deactivate the e-stop in general.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-12,2022-06-14  17:10:34,Johannes Schmidt,,alternative_deactivation_e-stop,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),No automatic movement release after e-stop deactivation,564082,11.0,2.4.12.4.1.2.1,"If the move request signal is still active after the emergency stop is deactivated again, the system shall block movements until a normal deactivation of the enable signal and re-activation took place. See <XREF>564245</XREF> for user messaging for emergency stop. Note: Safety architecture C + P, see <XREF>561860</XREF> and <XREF>543971</XREF>.´ For design constraints for single fault safety, see <XREF>578311</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-10,2022-09-29  14:15:27,Johannes Schmidt,,movement_after_estop_deactivation,,,SFSIEC 60601-1; 9.2.4 Emergency stopping devices,#Haz07,"Risk control measures are in place and reduce the risk as far as possible without adversely affecting the benefit-risk-ratio. Compliance to applicable regulations, technical standards and other design requirements limits the probability of occurrence of the scenario. Service activities ensure to maintain the integrity of the design and detect degradations. The operator manual warns to take care of potential crushing zones and requires the appropriate carefullness when releasing system movements, especially when additional parts are mounted at the C-arm, e. g. for navigation. Additional mitigations are not deemed to further reduce or prevent the risk of collision. Post market surveillance and complaint handling are in place to identify specific issues.",Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,2-C,2-B,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,"Patient,User,Environment",S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,E,Low,D,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Emergency stop self-test and failure exclusions,563483,14.0,2.4.12.4.1.3.1,"The emergency stop circuit shall be checked during start-up. In case the test is not passed, motorized movements shall remain blocked. Failure modes which cannot be self-tested or prevented shall be covered by failure exclusions.?Note 1: Safety architecture C + P, see <XREF>561860</XREF> and <XREF>543971</XREF>.For design constraints for single fault safety, see <XREF>578311</XREF>. Note 2: This mechanism does not cover mechanical failures of the emergency stop switches, therefore see <XREF>563484</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-05,2022-06-17  09:06:33,Johannes Schmidt,,SelfTestEmergencyStop,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,"MCU,HICHandControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,
