PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Braking force,564086,7.0,2.4.12.5.1.1.1,"The braking force needs to be sufficient to hold the system in standstill on an inclined plane of 5° in non-transport position (worst case position of axles), and of 10° in transport position.The braking force needs to be sufficient to hold the system in standstill during 3D. During any stopping scenario of the mecanum platform, the orbital and angular axle shall not move more than +/- 5° (brakes overridden due to inertia). Hint: Definition of ramp inclinations (5° and 10°) were in alignment with IEC 60601-1, clause 9.4.2.2",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-10,2022-05-12  18:03:33,Johannes Schmidt,,braking_force,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,MainU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Self-test of the brakes,564087,15.0,2.4.12.5.1.1.2,"An automatic brake test for mecanum wheels shall be performed at first chassis movement in order to detect if a brake does not work properly. This shall include the ability of the protection module to activate the brakes. The test shall be performed before a motorized movement takes place. If the test is not passed, the chassis movements shall remain blocked. ?Note: Safety architecture C + P, see <XREF>561860</XREF> and <XREF>543971</XREF>.For design constraints for single fault safety, see <XREF>578311</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-10,2022-06-17  09:07:14,Johannes Schmidt,,self-test_brakes,,,SFSFollow-up hazard: 06H571856,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Prerequisites click and go,564190,7.8,2.4.12.9.1.5.1,"Click and go shall only be possible when a patient is registered, an image has been acquired, and when the system can reconstruct the movement path. The function shall consider system movements between image acquisition and function activation, and shall consider image rotation and flip.(I. e. when a previous patient is loaded and an image is loaded again, the feature is not available; after a system reboot or activation of rescue function, the feature is not available.)",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-11,2022-02-11  14:51:38,Johannes Schmidt,,prerequisites_click_and_go,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VxFUTURE,"FLC,MCU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Provide rescue button,564129,4.9,2.4.15.1.1.1.1,The system chassis shall be able to be movable manually after an intentional action by the operator (e. g. releasing the brakes via a separate button which is secured against unintended activation) in case the chassis is not movable. The movement shall be possible with reasonable force (max. 400 N (200 N is threshold for mobile equipment propulsion under normal conditions)).,Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-11,2021-08-07  15:05:02,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,provide_rescue_button,,,IEC 60601-1; 9.2.5 Release of PATIENTIEC 60601-2-43; 201.7.9.2.102 Provisions for CPRIEC 60601-2-43; 201.15.101  Configuration for cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR),#Haz07,"Risk control measures are in place and reduce the risk as far as possible without adversely affecting the benefit-risk-ratio. Compliance to applicable regulations, technical standards and other design requirements limits the probability of occurrence of the scenario. Service activities ensure to maintain the integrity of the design and detect degradations. The operator manual warns to take care of potential crushing zones and requires the appropriate carefullness when releasing system movements, especially when additional parts are mounted at the C-arm, e. g. for navigation. Additional mitigations are not deemed to further reduce or prevent the risk of collision. Post market surveillance and complaint handling are in place to identify specific issues.",Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,empty,empty,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User,Environment",S1M,VB10,MainU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,E,Low,D,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Override angular / orbital brakes manually,562449,6.9,2.4.15.1.1.1.2,The orbital and angular axle shall be designed in a way that the axle is movable manually e. g. in case of a power failure.,Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-04-05  11:12:00,Rudolf Siebenhaar,,c-arm_manually_movement,,,"When orb. / ang. is functional, the brakes can be unlocked even with activated e-stop (no gravity loaded axles due to weight balance).",,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,MainU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Caution - Use rescue function,564130,3.10,2.4.15.1.1.1.3,"CAUTIONRisk: The system cannot be removed from the patient table in case of an emergency situation, e. g. cardiopulmonary resuscitation.Cause: Motorized system movements are blocked.Remedy: Check if any emergency stop has been activated and deactivate it. Use the rescue button in order to move the system away from the patient. Note that the orbital and angular axles still can be moved manually.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-11,2022-10-07  09:55:18,Johannes Schmidt,,use_recue_function,,,IEC 60601-1: cl. 7.2.13,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Rotate chassis with blocked mecanum wheel,564133,4.5,2.4.15.1.1.2.2,"In case one of the mecanum wheels is permanently blocked, the system shall still be able to be moved / rotated 45 ° with reasonable force (max. 400 N) after activating the rescue function.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-11,2021-08-07  15:04:31,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,rotate_chassis_blocked_mecanum_wheel,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,MainU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Reference - Provide rescue function,564140,2.5,2.4.15.1.1.2.3,<XREF>564129</XREF>,Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-11,2021-08-07  15:03:51,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,provide_rescue_function,,,,#Haz07,"Risk control measures are in place and reduce the risk as far as possible without adversely affecting the benefit-risk-ratio. Compliance to applicable regulations, technical standards and other design requirements limits the probability of occurrence of the scenario. Service activities ensure to maintain the integrity of the design and detect degradations. The operator manual warns to take care of potential crushing zones and requires the appropriate carefullness when releasing system movements, especially when additional parts are mounted at the C-arm, e. g. for navigation. Additional mitigations are not deemed to further reduce or prevent the risk of collision. Post market surveillance and complaint handling are in place to identify specific issues.",Headline,Basic,n.a.,none,n.a.,Not Determined,2-C,2-B,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,"Patient,User,Environment",S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,E,Low,D,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Prevent unintentional activation of rescue function by design,564151,6.0,2.4.15.1.2.1.1,"The unintentional activation of the rescue function due to technical errors shall be prevented by redundant activation channels (e. g. two switches and safety relays).Only when both channels are activated, the function shall be activated.Inconsistent activation of one channel or unintended permanent activation of both channels shall be checked during startup. In these cases movement shall be inhibited.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-11,2022-09-20  15:51:04,Johannes Schmidt,,protect_unintentional_activation_rescue,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Check rescue functionality during planned maintenance,576703,3.5,2.4.15.1.2.1.2,Work step during planned maintenance to ensure the correct functionality of the rescue function including correct deactivation of the function after releasing the button.,Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-12-21,2021-08-07  15:04:40,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,serv_check_rescue_function,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,Service Documentation,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Operator misuses the rescue function intentionally or unintentionally,564145,4.9,2.4.15.1.2.2,"e. g. being not aware of consequences, or unintentionally activates motorized movement",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-11,2022-09-26  16:53:43,Klaus-Peter Fichtner (EXT),,,,,,HS_042,See general justifications in the introduction which apply here.,Headline,Basic,n.a.,none,n.a.,Not Determined,3-B,3-A,Cause,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,Moving parts,"Patient,User,Service Personnel",S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,C,Med,B,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Prevent unintentional activation of rescue function by user error,564146,5.0,2.4.15.1.2.2.1,The button for initiating the rescue function shall be protected against unintended activation. The function shall require continuous activation by the operator and the activation signal shall be implemented redundantly.A consistency check of the rescue signals shall be performed at startup in order to detect a first failure in the rescue circuit. If the test is not passed the system shall be blocked.,Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-11,2022-09-28  15:32:06,Johannes Schmidt,,protect_unintentional_activation_rescue_user,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,"MainU,MCU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Inhibit motorized movements of chassis - rescue function,564147,17.0,2.4.15.1.2.2.2,"If the rescue button is activated during an ongoing movement, the movement shall be stopped by braking (regular braking ramp or quick-stop) in order to prevent spinning out of the drives. Once the movement is stopped the STO shall be activated and movement enable blocked for all motorized axes.Once the rescue button is disengaged the STO is deactivated and movements can be initiated again.?Note: Safety architecture C + P, see <XREF>561860</XREF> and <XREF>543971</XREF>.The SFS functionality is applicable for the breaking functionality, not for recognition and display of of first errors. For design constraints for single fault safety, see <XREF>578311</XREF>.´",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-11,2022-09-26  11:21:38,Johannes Schmidt,,inhibit_motorized_movements_rescue,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Warning - Correct use of rescue function,564148,8.0,2.4.15.1.2.2.3,"WARNINGCause: Rescue button is operated incorrectly.Risk: Increased risk of collision, risk of injury to patient or operator, risk of damage to the system or other equipment.Remedy: The rescue button is only to be used in emergency situations when immediate access to the patient is required, e. g. for cardiopulmonary resuscitation. Do not operate other motorized movements when rescue button is activated. Do not operate the function during movements.Note that the collision detection and emergency stop will have no effect when this function is activated.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-11,2022-06-18  10:52:50,Johannes Schmidt,,docUser_correct_use_rescue,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Block radiation when controls connecting,562292,2.3,2.4.18.2.1.1.1,"The system shall check the status of both radiation release signal paths when controls are connected to the system.When an active radiation release signal path is detected, radiation from the affected control (sharing one enable hardware line) shall be blocked and an error message shall be displayed, until a deactivation and regular re-activation of both radiation release paths takes place.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:04:54,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,Check_X-RaySwitchAtHotPlug_s1,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,N.A.,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Labeling wireless hand control radiation,596992,3.5,2.4.18.2.1.2.1,"CAUTIONCause: Radiation released from a wireless hand control in another roomPossible Consequences: Non-clinical exposure to ionizing radiationRemedy: As part of the system installation, the wireless hand control is labeled according to which system it belongs to.When utilizing the wireless hand control, check that it belongs to the system according to the indicating labels.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Johannes Schmidt,,,2022-06-23,2022-10-07  09:56:39,Johannes Schmidt,,docUser_labeling_wireless_hand_control_radiation,,,IEC 60601-1: cl. 7.2.13,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Optical indication of system and hand controls radiation,596634,3.5,2.4.18.2.1.2.2,"In Service Documentation?CAUTIONCause: Radiation released from a remote hand control in another roomPossible Consequences: Non-clinical exposure to ionizing radiationRemedy: Before performing any service activities with the remote hand control, check that the remote hand control belongs to the system and check that the indicating label is in place and properly visible.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Johannes Schmidt,,,2022-05-18,2022-09-20  11:34:07,Johannes Schmidt,,docServ_optical_indication_wireless_radiation,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,Service Documentation,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),No system movement during or between subtraction and roadmap phases,591778,10.3,2.4.18.4.1.1.1,"Case 1: Movement during radiation in subtraction or roadmap mode:When a movement of any system axle is detected during any phase of acquiring an image in subtraction or roadmap mode, the workflow shall be aborted, radiation shall be stopped. Case 2: Movement between acquired peak opacification image within a subtraction workflow and roadmap acquisition:When a movement of any system axle is detected between an acquired peak opacification image within a subtraction and a planned roadmap acquisition, the system shall discard this outdated peak opacification image (not allow roadmap), but instead, shall start the subtraction workflow automatically.",ToBeReviewed,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2021-09-02,2022-06-20  14:10:31,Johannes Schmidt,,_sub_road_no_system_movement,,,"IEC 60601-2-43, cl. 201.12.4.105 ",,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VxFUTURE,"FLC,MCU,XCU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Warning - Prevent movements during roadmap workflow,591779,4.5,2.4.18.4.1.1.2,"WARNING Cause: Movements of the patient, of the system, or deformations of the vessel tree between acquiring the mask image and using it as mask in the Roadmap workflow. Possible consequences: Treatment at the wrong location.Remedy:- Prevent the movement of the patient’s relevant body region between acquiring the mask and using it as a mask in the Roadmap workflows.- Check whether the device position in the image is matching with the vessel tree.- In case of doubt, visualize the actual vessel position by means of a short contrast injection and check it versus the vessel tree in the mask.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2021-09-02,2022-06-29  15:00:57,Johannes Schmidt,,docUser_prevent_movement_roadmap,,,"IEC 60601-2-43, cl. 201.12.4.105 ",,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Prerequisites panorama imaging,564280,6.3,2.4.18.6.2.1.1,"The acquisition of a panorama image shall only be possible when- a patient is registered, an image has been acquired on which the planning took place (path planning must have taken place and been completed in standstill)- when the system has not been moved and no image rotation or flip took place between path planning / confirmation and movement activation- no collimation error (collimator must be able to reach the correct slot positions for the panorama slices)- enough storage capacity must be available for the maximum scan length- tube temperature must be sufficiently low to be able to complete the maximum scan length",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-12,2022-02-11  14:52:11,Johannes Schmidt,,prerequisites_panorama_imaging,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VxFUTURE,"FLC,MCU,XCU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Caution - Close mecanum cover after cleaning,568824,9.1,2.4.36.1.1.1.1,"CAUTIONCause: Incorrect cleaning of wheels.Risk: Increased risk of crushing e.g., of fingers, risk of damage to the system.Remedy: Clean the wheels according to the instructions. Disconnect the C-arm chassis from the trolley. Do not move the system while a person is cleaning wheels. Before opening the wheel covers, activate the lock movement function at the chassis handle panel. Store wireless hand control in drawer and wired hand control in holder. Close the wheel covers after cleaning activities are finished.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-31,2022-10-07  09:57:24,Johannes Schmidt,,docUser_cleaning_mecanum,,,IEC 60601-1: cl. 7.2.13,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"User,Service Personnel",S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Cable conduit for movable cables,562037,2.5,2.4.42.2.9.3.1,"Moving components such like cables, plugs, screws which are located in the proximity of isolators or wires may come into contact with voltages and increase the risk of fire or electric shocks. Mitigation is performed by fixing all moving wires, plugs connectors, etc. with means such like cable conduit, cable straps, plastic bridges or screws, glue, heat shrink tubes, etc. to avoid contacts caused by attrition.This measure is in accordance to IEC60601-1:2005 chap. 8.10. Note:Movable components are affected by e.g. adjustment of monitor height or horizontal movement of C-arm (but not limited to). In addition, this shall address service workflows as well (e.g. pulling components from its defined position in system during maintenance or replacement).",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-03-10  12:54:12,Rudolf Siebenhaar,,cable_conduit_for_movable_cables,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,"User,Service Personnel",S1M,VB10,"MainU,TrolleyU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Rough handling test (main unit),562087,16.10,2.4.43.1.5.1.1,"The chassis shall be designed to comply with IEC 60601-1 cl. 15.3.5. Scenarios to be tested: - Transport position of the system reached and fast drive move activated for a) Ascending step shock, b) Descending step shock, c) Door frame shock and forward direction (Note: During a) and c) the collision avoidance is activated and slows down the system to operating room speed. For b) fast drive mode speed is applied.) - Transport position of the system and operating room speed for a), b), c) in forward and lateral direction (Note: During a) and c), this is expected to repeat the first test with a) and c) with collision avoidance activated. b) is expected to be less critical than the first test with b) with transport speed).",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-03-10  13:17:35,Rudolf Siebenhaar,,rough_handling_test,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,MainU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Drop test,562092,2.7,2.4.43.1.6.1.1,"The portable control elements except Hand-Helds with masses <= 10 kg have to be designed so that they can be dropped from a height of 5 cm without having damages that cause unacceptable risks.Hand-Helds have to be designed to withstand drop from heights at which the ME EQUIPMENT is used (as specified in the ACCOMPANYING DOCUMENTS), or from a height of 1 m, whichever is greater, onto a 50 mm +/-5 mm thick hardwood board (hardwood > 600 kg/m3) lying flat on a concrete or a similar rigid base.Test criterion:Execute drop tests according to standard IEC 60601-1 at heights of 5 cm for portable mobile control panels or heights of >= 1m for Hand-Helds. Possible emerged damages have to be examined for hazards (e.g. access to electrical and moveable parts has to be prevented).",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-02-03  14:37:55,Ingo Hollenborg,,drop_test,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,User,S1M,VB10,"HICSwitch,HICTouchCon",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Supply Chain Documentation  - Toxic Materials,562096,2.0,2.4.43.1.7.1.1,"Make note in the relevant factory documents. How these parts are disposed in an environmentally friendly manner have to be documented in the disposal instructions.Cause: Toxic materialsPossible consequences: Toxic contamination in case of detector panel is broken by mechanical shockRemedy: Handle detector with care! If the detector is broken do not use it, inspect if any particles are spilled. Leaked particles have to be collected and kept in a sealed container. Spilled particles have to be returned to Siemens Healthineers.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-06-27  11:16:21,Johannes Schmidt,,manu_detector_toxic_material_s1,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,Factory Documentation,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,"Leaking subst. that are carcinogenic, mutagenic, toxic",,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Service Instruction - Toxic Materials,562097,3.0,2.4.43.1.7.1.2,"Make note in the relevant service documents. How these parts are disposed in an environmentally friendly manner have to be documented in the disposal instructions. CAUTION Cause: Toxic material is accessible when the image intensifier / flat detector is damaged due to mechanical impact.Possible consequences: Skin or eye irritation, irritation of the breathing passages, toxic or allergic reactions caused by contact with hazardous substances.Remedy: Handle the image intensifier / flat detector with care. If it is damaged, do not use it. Inspect if any particles are spilled. Avoid skin contact and inhalation of dust, use personal protective equipment if required. Spilled particles have to be collected and kept in a sealed container and returned to Siemens Healthineers for disposal.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-06-27  11:16:56,Johannes Schmidt,,docServ_detector_toxic_material_s1,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,Service Documentation,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,"Leaking subst. that are carcinogenic, mutagenic, toxic",,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Robust trolley-chassis cable,569245,5.0,2.4.43.2.1.1.2,"Robust trolley-chassis cable The system shall prevent damage to trolley-chassis cable from extensive tension caused by movements of the Main Unit.Note, a collision detection system is implemented which detects tension at the TC cable. The trolley chassis cable shall tolerate forces and bending up to the limit when tension detection is activated.<XREF>563740</XREF>",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-09-14,2022-03-04  14:25:29,Johannes Schmidt,,robust_tc_cable,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,"Patient,User,Service Personnel",S1M,VB10,TrolleyU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Cable anchorage,562104,2.0,2.4.43.2.1.1.3,"All power cables have to be protected against cable damage to prevent electrical shock. In addition, it has to ensured, that system's connection to power line remains active as long as possible (a connection via socket outlet and plug is not sufficient). All power cables need to be secured with cable anchorage / strain-relief, e.g. by means of a strain-relief sleeve.Pull forces for cable retention and cable anchorage shall be in accordance to IEC62444-2010 (Table 2).",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-06-20  09:36:33,Johannes Schmidt,,cord_anchorage,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,TrolleyU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Check radiation release signal status at startup,562134,3.4,2.4.43.2.5.1.1,"The system shall check the status of both radiation release signal paths at startup of every control.When an active radiation release signal path is detected, radiation from the affected control (sharing one enable hardware line) shall be blocked and an error message shall be displayed, until a deactivation and regular re-activation of both radiation release paths take place.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-06-21  08:54:47,Johannes Schmidt,,Check_X-RaySwitchAtStartUp_s1,,,SFS,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),User manual - No Archive Medium,562159,2.4,2.4.43.2.6.7.1,"CAUTIONCause: Loss of image dataPossible Consequences: Risk of unnecessary X-ray exposureRemedy:- The hard disk of the imaging system is not suitable for long-term archiving of patient and image data. There are statutory requirements governing the archiving period, data availability, and data security (data integrity), as well as recommendations concerning fire protection or water damage for the archiving of image data. The operator of the archive is responsible for observing these regulations.- Because of advances in technical development and statutory requirements, the storage of image data and access to it cannot be realized with a single storage and media technology alone. Therefore, the migration of data may be necessary under the responsibility of the operator of the digital archive.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:04:37,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,docUser_no_archive_medium,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),User Manual - Switch off the system in the event of fire,562218,2.6,2.4.43.6.4.1.2,"WARNING:Cause: Fire in or near the system.Possible consequences: Injury to patient and personnel, and damage to device. Risk of gas poisoning due to burning plastic.Remedy:- In case of fire switch off the system.- Be aware of and inform patients of escape routes.- Be aware of where fire extinguishers are located and know how to use them.- In case of fire switch off the system.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:04:37,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,um_HintsForFire,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Surface temperature applied parts,562222,20.1,2.4.43.6.5.1.2,"For all surfaces which can be touched by the patient (applied parts according to IEC 60601-1 cl. 4.6, <XREF>561933</XREF>), the surface temperatures under normal and single fault conditions according to IEC 60601-1, table 24 (see <XREF>434357</XREF>)  for the following contact duration shall be applied:Affected components and areas:- Cover of the detector incl. FD handle and panel: 10 min <= t- Cover of the monoblock, excluded monoblock backside: 1 min <= t <10 min- Wired and wireless hand control: 10 min <= t- Remote control panel on the rear: t < 1 min (relatively heavy, therefore it is not expected to be placed on the patient directly, besides shortly putting it down, when mounted at the table, the patient cannot come into contact with the rear side)- Remote control panel on the top and the sides: 1 min <= t < 10 min- C-shaped mechanics of the system: 1 min <= t < 10 min",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-07-15  14:43:32,Nils Naarmann,,surface_temperature_applied_parts,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,High temperature,,S1M,VB10,"HICTouchCon,MainU,HICForceControl,HICHandControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1;Current Baseline;06H_Risk_Analysis (06H);Temperature sensor self test;562225;2.3;2.4.43.6.5.1.3;During operating of the system there will be a self test of the temperature sensing circuit. In the case of a defect x-ray radiation will be prevented.;Approved;Unassigned;Judith Welzel;Judith;Welzel;Judith Welzel;;;2020-07-29;2021-08-07  15:04:38;Yesin Gasmi (EXT);;TemperatureSensor_SelfTest;;;;;;Requirement;Basic;System Integration Test;none;n.a.;Not Determined;Not determined;Not determined;Measure;TBD;NotDetermined;NotDetermined;NotDetermined;NotDetermined;No;None;;;S1M;VB10;XGen;;;;;;;;;;;;;NotDetermined;;;;

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),System Warning - Temperature of the Detector,562226,3.1,2.4.43.6.5.1.4,"The temperature inside the detector is checked quasi-continously (i.e. short interval) by FLC. According to the detector type an appropiate warning for the user is displayed, when first warning temperature is reached. When the second warning temperature is reached, an additional warning message is displayed to inform the user.Temperature for first warning message:- 52°C for FDmediumHTemperature for 2nd warning message:- 54°C for FDmediumHThe detector will not be switched off at any time, during an intervention.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-09-16  12:44:43,Javier Lopez Leal,,FDTemperature_Switchoff_s1,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,High temperature,,S1M,VB10,"FDmediumH,FLC",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),User Manual - Hot tube,562228,2.6,2.4.43.6.5.1.5,"CAUTIONCause: Under extreme operating conditions (continuous operation close to the maximum tube voltage), the X-ray tube can become very hot. This can shorten the service life of the system components. Possible consequences: Risk of burns and prolongation of the operation! Remedy:- Avoid touching the X-ray tube housing.- Change your parameter settings, e.g. by reducing the dose level.- We also recommend keeping a second system ready for continuous radiation lasting longer than 30 minutes.- Please make sure that the system has cooled down before performing critical interventional applications.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:04:38,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,um_tube_hot,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,High temperature,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),ServiceDoc - Hot tube housing,562229,2.5,2.4.43.6.5.1.6,"Service DocumentsCAUTIONCause: In extreme operating mode (continuous operation),  the temperature of the X-ray tube assembly can heat up.Possible consequences: Danger of burns.Remedy: Avoid contact with the tube housing",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:04:38,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,serv_um_tube_hot,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,Service Documentation,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,High temperature,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),User Manual - Cleaning and draping,562240,2.0,2.4.43.6.7.1.2,"WARNINGCause: Fluid or blood seeps into the system, use of inappropriate cleaning agents.Possible consequences: Risk of damage to the system, risk of infection or electrical hazard.Remedy: Use sterile or sterilizable covers at least in C-arm area (C-arm, cover of the flat detector and X-ray monobloc). Do not let cleaning liquids seep into the openings of the system (e.g. air openings, gaps between covers). Observe the cleaning and disinfection instructions. Only use the recommended substances for cleaning and disinfection.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-06-27  14:04:28,Johannes Schmidt,,um_CleaningOfMaterial,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),IEC 60601-1 Clause 8.7 and 8.8,562365,6.24,2.4.45.1.3.3.1,"The system shall comply with IEC 60601-1 cl. 8.7 and 8.8.Voltages which are accessible without tool shall not exceed 42,4 V peak a. c. and 60 V d. c.Touch current and patient leakage currents shall comply with cl. 8.7The operator shall be protected by 2 MOOP.The patient shall be protected by 2 MOPP.Applied parts of type B according to cl. 4.6 are:- Cover of the detector incl. PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Stop vertical lift,562384,2.7,2.4.45.2.1.3.1,"When the system is moved downwards, the movement shall be stopped at a safety distance of min. 120 mm between the floor and the C-arm parts (either detector or monoblock rotated downwards). Note: The crushing distance for feet between C-arm and front side of the wheel cover of the chassis is allowed to be below 120 mm due to the crushing label on the cover. The crushing distance for toes of 50 mm is met.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-03-04  13:41:42,Rudolf Siebenhaar,,stop_vertical_lift,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,InPreReview,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,User,S1M,VB10,"MainU,MCU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Acoustic signal,562385,4.3,2.4.45.2.1.3.2,"After reaching the safety distance in <XREF>562384</XREF>, an acoustic alarm signal is triggered, when the C-arm is moved further downwards in direction of crushing hazard. When a distance of min. 25 mm between horizontal unit and the top of the chassisis reached, downwards movement shall be stopped and prevented. Note: Crushing distance for toes between floor and C-arm or C-arm and front side of the wheel cover of the chassis is allowed to be below 50 mm due to acoustic signal and crushing label.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-04-05  13:28:25,Rudolf Siebenhaar,,acoustic_signal,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,User,S1M,VB10,"MainU,MCU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Service Instruction - periodic maintenance,562406,2.4,2.4.45.2.2.4.1,"Demagnetization may appear, if one of following actions will affect on OR table holder1) external magnetic field (magnetic hysteresis, coercivity field Hc),2) strong heating (threshold: Curie temperature), and/or3) strong hits/shocks There is no external magnetic field available. Temperature thresholds to demagnetize are 310-340° Celsius (Neodym or Neodym-Iron-Boron combinations, NdFeB) 354 degree Celsius (Nickel, Ni), and 450° Celsius (Ferrite, i.e. Fe2O3 or Fe3O4 combinations), and 770° Celsius (Iron, Fe).These environmental conditions will not appear in lifetime.Remaining issue are (3) strong hits/shocks. These seems to be very unlikely that this kind of force will be applied to the OR table holder, but can be assumed as improbable, but not impossible. Therefore, magnetic force of OR table holder shall be checked during periodic maintenance: The magnets must fix the RCP so that pulling them with up to 150N will not loosen the RCP from the OR table holder.""or ""The magnets shall fix the RCP so that, when pulling on it with at least 150N, the RCP will not loosen from the OR holder.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:04:16,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,docServ_periodic_maintenance_magnetic_force,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,Service Documentation,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VxFUTURE,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Additional safety mechanism - lift column,562419,7.5,2.4.45.2.3.3.1,"There shall be a mechanical safety mechanism for the lift column which prevents the C-arm from crashing down in case of a spindle failure.The mechanical safety mechanism shall be designed to fulfill a tensile safety factor >= 4.The overtravel (stopping distance from the time of engagement to the time of no further movement) shall be max. 5 mm.Note: IEC 60601-1, cl. 9.8.4 Systems with MECHANICAL PROTECTIVE DEVICES",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-03-10  13:24:42,Rudolf Siebenhaar,,existing_additional_safety_equipment,,,"IEC 60601-1, cl. 9.8.4",,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,MainU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Activation of safety mechanism blocks lift drive,562420,12.6,2.4.45.2.3.3.2,"After the activation of the mechanical safety mechanism <XREF>562419</XREF> of the vertical column, the operation of the lift drive shall not be possible anymore.Note: The drive is not capable of moving again due to the activated mechanism, and an motor overcurrent message is displayed. The column can be manually screwed down with a tool (ratch) only which can be inserted in a whole at the bottom of the chassis (moving it down is necessary for transporting it back to the factory). Repair is only done in factory, not in the field.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-03-10  13:25:19,Rudolf Siebenhaar,,activation_of_safety_feature_blocks_drive,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,MainU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Design without crushing zones,562431,2.8,2.4.45.2.4.4.1,"The OR table holder shall have a flat design (e.g. without beadings), so size of emerging gaps between OR table holder and mounted RCP are above threshold (> 25 mm), in accordance to finger gaps for adults in IEC60601-1:2005 clause 9.2.2.2 (Table 20).In case of  a non-flat design of OR table holder a protection for all possible finger positions during mounting of RCP shall be available.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-06-20  17:19:46,Johannes Schmidt,,OR_table_holder_crushing_zones,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VxFUTURE,"AccesS,MainU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Spillage of Liquids on System,562549,5.0,2.4.45.6.8.1.1,"Spillage of liquids on system shall not result in a hazardous situation. The system shall be designed in accordance to IEC 60601-1 clause 11.6.3 (compliance to spillage test). The spillage test shall be performed with following instructions: Spillage test, scenario 1: * Scenario: capacity of drapes/ max. suction performance exhausted * liquid is seeping continuously from operating area downwards on the system * Quantity: 500 ml; duration: 30 min * Effected parts of system: FD/I.I., monoblock, C-arm (without Chassis) Spillage test, scenario 2: * Scenario: splatter of blood * liquid is splashing from operating area up- and/or sidewards to the system * Quantity: 20 ml; duration: approx. 1 s (i.e. a bolus) * Effected parts of system: FD/I.I., monoblock, C-arm (without Chassis) No liquids need to be spilled on trolley (incl. trolley control panel, TCP). Hints:Spilling of FD is only allowed with coverage of drape (see <XREF>562552</XREF>).Remote control panel (RCP) will be used with drapes only.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-06-17  11:16:31,Johannes Schmidt,,compliance_with_a_spillage_test,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User,System",S1M,VB10,MainU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Quasi-continuous activation of radiation with redundant activation paths,580167,3.0,2.4.45.6.9.5.2,"Radiation shall be possible only when two redundant signals provided by two independent paths are present within certain time constraints (quasi-continuous activation), preventing unintended X-ray activation.When only one of two signals is present, radiation shall be stopped and inhibited for the respective control.?Note: Safety architecture C + P, see <XREF>561860</XREF> and <XREF>543971</XREF>. For design constraints for single fault safety, see <XREF>578311</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2021-06-07,2022-06-17  09:08:32,Johannes Schmidt,,safe_activation_X-ray,,,SFSIEC 60601-1; 9.2.3.1 Unintended movementIEC 60601-2-54; 201.9.2.3.1 Unintended movementIEC 60601-1; 9.2.2.5 Continuous activationIEC 60601-2-54; 201.9.2.2.5 Continuous activation,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"Patient,User",S1M,VB10,"HICSwitch,MCU,XCU,XGen,HICHandControl",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),User Manual - Mismatch of AAA Line,562596,2.3,2.4.45.6.10.8.1,"WARNINGCause: An annotated image with graphic overlay lines is displayed. Following system and/or table or patient movements and/or image modifications, subsequent images may not match the overlay line displayed due to projective changes. Possible Consequences: Incorrect interpretation of the display and resulting incorrect decision during operation! Remedy: The graphic overlay line is displayed until the user actively turns it off.This is done independently of any changes (for example, movements, operating mode changes, image modifications). The user must ensure that the displayed overlay line matches the current, underlying image (for example, display of anatomical structures via the label function and/or use of contrast agent).",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:04:07,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,docUser_AAA_line_mismatch,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,N.A.,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Storage capacity exhausted,562612,4.0,2.4.45.6.11.1.1,"When the image storage limit is reached, the system shall inhibit further radiography. PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Injector trigger in dedicated modes and conditions only,581162,6.1,2.4.45.6.13.1.2,"The system shall trigger the injector only in the following modes and conditions:- Subtraction- Roadmap: Only when the operator has not performed a subtraction before (then automatically a subtraction scene is performed when roadmap is selected), or when no valid peak opacification image is available (e. g. after changing magnification)- Digital Cine Mode Note: That means when a subtraction has been performed before roadmap is selected, then the injector shall not be triggered when roadmap is performed.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2021-07-22,2021-08-07  15:05:58,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,injector_trigger_dedicated_modes,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VxFUTURE,"MCU,XCU",,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Display when injector is armed,581195,4.3,2.4.45.6.13.1.3,"The system shall display when the injector is armed, when the conditions under <XREF>581162</XREF> are fulfilled (that means that upon next X-ray release, the injector is triggered).",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2021-07-22,2021-08-07  15:05:58,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,display_injector_armed,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VxFUTURE,MCU,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1;Current Baseline;06H_Risk_Analysis (06H);User Manual - Injector Readiness;562625;3.1;2.4.45.6.14.1.1;CAUTIONCause: Radiation release without without contrast agent injection or unintended injection.Possible consequences: Risk of unnecessary radiation exposure or unintended contrast agent injection.Remedy: Make sure that the injector is ready to administer contrast agent before releasing radiation. PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Restricted platform movement range with plugged injector,581194,2.4,2.4.45.6.14.2.1,"When the injector is plugged, motorized movements of the mecanum platform shall be restricted to a distance of < 50 cm. When it is reached, the system shall stop motorized movements and display an appropriate error message.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2021-07-22,2021-08-07  15:05:57,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,restrict_move_range_injector,,,,#Haz50 #Haz40 ,Risk control measures are in place and reduce the risk as far as possible without adversely affecting the benefit-risk-ratio. The system complies with applicable regulations and technical standards. The operator manual advises to check the injector status prior to using it in combination with the system. This limits the probability of occurrence of this hazardous situation. Additional mitigations are not deemed to further reduce or prevent the risk. Post market surveillance and complaint handling are in place to identify specific issues.,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,1-C,1-C,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,Patient,S1M,VxFUTURE,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,E,Low,E,

PS_S1;Current Baseline;06H_Risk_Analysis (06H);Unplug injector cable during movement;595189;3.0;2.4.45.6.14.2.2;CAUTIONCause: A strain might be applied to the injector cable when plugged during movements.Possible consequence: The injector cable can get damaged or unplugged during a chassis movement of the system.Remedy: Unplug the injector cable if you perform longer movements that might put tension on the cable.;InWork;Unassigned;Johannes Schmidt;Johannes;Schmidt;Johannes Schmidt;;;2022-02-28;2022-07-27  15:29:37;Johannes Schmidt;;um_unplug_injector_during_movement;;;;;;Requirement;empty;System Integration Test;EXPORT;User Manual;empty;Not determined;Not determined;Measure;TBD;NotDetermined;NotDetermined;NotDetermined;NotDetermined;Yes;None;;System;S1M;VB10;;;;;;;;;;;;;;NotDetermined;;;;

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Image display delay time,568834,20.0,2.4.45.6.15.1.1,"An image display delay time of max. 200 ms is determined to be practicable based on the image processing capabilities of the system and to ensure sufficient reaction time for the operator for all imaging modes except Single Image. Note, the achieved image display delay time will then be below the average human reaction time of ~ 300 ms according to Sigmund Exner. For Single Image, which includes DR (Digital Radiography), DR-SUM (Digital Radiography with several pulses) and 3D Scan, as well as DCM and Subtraction, the image display delay time might be up to 4 s.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-31,2022-06-08  17:00:40,Johannes Schmidt,,image_display_delay_time,,,IEC 60601-2-43; cl. 201.12.4.102,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,Verification&Validation,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Image display delay time - external,568835,13.1,2.4.45.6.15.1.2,"If an external device is utilized to display images acquired with the CIOS system via the NXS interface, the image display delay time shall be evaluated as part of the vendor risk management.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-08-31,2022-06-24  09:34:06,Johannes Schmidt,,image_display_delay_time_ext,,,IEC 60601-2-43; cl. 201.12.4.102,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,Supplier,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Caution in user manual to image display delay,596894,6.1,2.4.45.6.15.1.3,"CAUTION Cause: Radiography modes are misused for real-time imaging on purpose by the operator. Possible consequences: With Radiography modes the image display delay time may be longer than in Radioscopy modes and may exceed limits for accepted delays for real-time imaging. Remedy: For real-time imaging do only select Radioscopy modes such as Fluoro and Road. Do not select Radiography modes (e.g. single image including DR, DR-Sum, 3D Scan, DCM, Subtraction) for real-time imaging.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Johannes Schmidt,,,2022-06-08,2022-06-24  09:34:23,Johannes Schmidt,,docUser_image_display_delay,,,IEC 60601-2-43; cl. 201.12.4.102,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,Patient,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),User Manual - High-Energy-Isotopes,599844,3.1,2.4.45.6.18.1.2,"Caution Cause: Flat detector hardware is exposed to high-energy isotopes at low proximity, e.g. by means of Cobalt-60  radiation sources during BrachytherapyPossible consequences: Flat detector hardware damaged, leading to low image quality or image artifactsRemedy: Keep the detector system and electronics in a safe distance (> 3 m) from high-energy isotopes (> 1 MeV), e.g., during the insertion or removal process of the radiation probe in Brachytherapy.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Johannes Schmidt,,,2022-08-30,2022-09-29  14:35:34,Johannes Schmidt,,um_high_energy_isotopes,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,empty,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,System,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),User Manual - Patient ID,562650,1.8,2.4.45.8.1.1.1,"CAUTIONCause: Patient ID already exists.Possible Consequences: Misinterpretation of data of the examined patient if the selection is based solely on the patient ID.Remedy:-Always use four-way identification [patient name, sex, date of birth, patient ID].- Avoid mixing up patient data by using four-way identification. PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),NGS protocol with speed detection,562662,4.0,2.4.45.10.1.1.2,"Use of reliable data transfer standards and protocols (i.e. TCP/IP protocol for Ethernet-based communication) with a link speed detection. PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),NGS protocol with link loss detection,562663,5.0,2.4.45.10.1.1.3,"Use of reliable data transfer standards and protocols (i.e. TCP/IP protocol for Ethernet-based communication) with a heartbeat and link loss detection. Its also valid for OpenApps.If the link loss is detected, it shall be indicated to the user and an automatic release of mouse events shall occur.",Approved,Unassigned,Sonali Rath,Sonali,Rath,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-01-26  14:44:49,Sonali Rath,,NGS_link_loss_detection,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,HICTouchCon,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),NGS protocol with latency detection,562664,6.0,2.4.45.10.1.1.4,"Use of reliable data transfer standards and protocols (i.e. TCP/IP protocol for Ethernet-based communication) with a latency detection. This means measuring the time between sending a frame till receiving this frame and in case of exceeding a configurable limit to indicate it with an audible or visual indicator. VxFUTURE:  when using NGS in the OpenApps context, the latency detection shall be configurable specific to the app (i.e. either deactivated or threshold value adjusted based on the Risk Managmenent of the individual partner apps).",Approved,Unassigned,Sonali Rath,Sonali,Rath,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-06-13  10:07:17,Sonali Rath,,NGS_latency_detection,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,HICTouchCon,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1;Current Baseline;06H_Risk_Analysis (06H);NGS protocol with update rate detection;562665;7.0;2.4.45.10.1.1.5;Use of reliable data transfer standards and protocols (i.e. TCP/IP protocol for Ethernet-based communication) with a update rate detection between two frames. In case of  exceeding a configurable time an audible or visual indication shall be done.  VxFUTURE: This can be configured individually for partner apps (either deactivated or a threshold value configured based on the respective partner app's Risk Manamagement proposal) in case of OpenApps.;Approved;Unassigned;Sonali Rath;Sonali;Rath;Judith Welzel;;;2020-07-29;2022-06-21  14:56:08;Johannes Schmidt;;NGS_update_rate_detection;;;;;;Requirement;Basic;System Integration Test;none;n.a.;Not Determined;Not determined;Not determined;Measure;Accepted;NotDetermined;NotDetermined;NotDetermined;NotDetermined;No;None;;;S1M;VB10;HICTouchCon;;;;;;;;;;;;;NotDetermined;;;;

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),NGS protocol with data integrity,562666,3.0,2.4.45.10.1.1.6,"For transfer of frames via NGS the data integrity of these frames shall be considered by using a check sum algorithm (e.g CRC32). In case of  an incorrect checksum is detected an audible or visual indication shall be done.  When NGS is used in context of OpenApps, the temporal integrity of an image series that builds on one another must also be monitored using a checksum. Incase of a missing image or incorrect CRC, an audible or visual indication shall be available.",Approved,Unassigned,Sonali Rath,Sonali,Rath,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-01-17  12:16:25,Sonali Rath,,NGS_payload_integrity,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,HICTouchCon,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Caution - Reduced image quality streaming,569238,10.0,2.4.45.10.1.1.9,"CAUTION?Cause: When streaming via external systems, image quality (e.g., resolution, frame rate or flickering) might be affected by connector type or external monitor hardware and settings.?Possible Consequences: Reduced image qualityRemedy: In order to avoid loss of image quality ensure that the connection cable specifications and display parameters of the connected external monitors fulfill the required specifications as described in the chapter Technical Specifications ------ Not part of Caution: Note, the required specifications for the external monitor are medical grade, 4K, color display, 3840x2160 pixels, 60Hz, and 4:4:4 Chroma Subsampling. The cable requirements are a short HDMI2.0 (or better) video cable (<3m) between CIOS Move and external monitor or fiber optic cable.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Judith Welzel,,,2020-09-14,2022-09-16  15:05:19,Johannes Schmidt,,um_image_quality_streaming,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Other wireless devices act as remote control,562707,1.9,2.4.45.15.1.1,,Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-10-12  11:49:27,Johannes Schmidt,,,,,,#Haz07,"Risk control measures are in place and reduce the risk as far as possible without adversely affecting the benefit-risk-ratio. Compliance to applicable regulations, technical standards and other design requirements limits the probability of occurrence of the scenario. Service activities ensure to maintain the integrity of the design and detect degradations. The operator manual warns to take care of potential crushing zones and requires the appropriate carefullness when releasing system movements, especially when additional parts are mounted at the C-arm, e. g. for navigation. Additional mitigations are not deemed to further reduce or prevent the risk of collision. Post market surveillance and complaint handling are in place to identify specific issues.",Headline,Basic,n.a.,none,n.a.,Not Determined,2-C,2-C,Cause,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,"Patient,User,System",S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,E,Low,D,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),User Manual - Reduced accuracy of 3D reconstruction,562927,4.0,2.4.45.52.1.1.2,"CAUTIONCause:  Insufficient geometric accuracy of 3D reconstruction due to an incomplete and/or angulated 3D scan and/or 3D scan started away from 0-positions.Possible consequences: Wrong interventional decision or treatment!Remedy:- Make sure that a complete 3D scan of the entire orbital range is performed.Note, for partial scans it is only required to ensure that the scan is performed within the selected start- and endposition.- Make sure that the C-arm is in 0-position for the angulation axis.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-06-21  15:23:37,Johannes Schmidt,,docUser_reduced_accuracy_of_3D_reconstruction,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,User Manual,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Service Documentation - Navigation system test after recalibration,563058,2.3,2.4.45.56.3.3.2,"Service DocumentationCAUTIONCause: After a geometry calibration for 3D mode, or after modifications impairing the operation or accuracy of the´navigation system, no recalibration with the relevant navigation system is performed.Possible consequences: Inaccurate navigation results, risk of injury for the patient.Remedy:- After a 3D geometry calibration or any modification impairing the operation or accuracy of the navigation system, a recalibration needs to be performed with the relevant navigation system.- The operator shall be informed verbally and / or in writing, that the accuracy of the navigation system must be checked.- The relevant parts that influence the navigation accuracy are listed in the Replacement of Parts document.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:04:12,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,docCS_recalibration_for_3d_mode,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,Service Documentation,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Service Caution - Servicing battery components,563204,3.1,2.4.46.13.2.2.3,"Service Documentation CAUTION Cause: Incorrect handling of battery components during service, for example, wearing metal objects such as rings, watches or bracelets, or using tools with non-insulated handles when servicing the battery components, could lead to an accidental short-circuit of the battery contacts. Potential consequences: Risk of burns due to high short-circuit current and of destroying the battery component. Remedy: Before servicing the battery components, remove watches, rings, bracelets and all other metal objects from the hands and arms. Use tools with insulated handles.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:05:48,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,docCS_exchange_batteries,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,Service Documentation,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,Accepted,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,"User,Service Personnel,System,Environment",S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Service Instruction - Measures to prevent infection due to contaminated system parts - service,563207,2.3,2.4.46.13.3.1.1,"Warning in Service InstructionWARNINGCause: Service, disassembly or refurbishment activities on hardware parts of Cios systems which had been in clinical use and are potentially contaminated.Possible consequences: Increased risk of infection due to residues of infectious substances such as bodily fluids or deposits of organic matter colonized with microorganismsRemedy: Consequently apply precautionary measures for handling potentially infectious material, especially:- Wear protective gloves, closed and long-sleeved protective clothing, protective shoes, and protective glasses.- In case of severe contamination or strong infectiousness, in case the contamination may be dusting or emit droplets, apply additional measures such as face masks and disposable protective clothing, for example overalls and caps.- After finishing the activities on contaminated hardware parts, clean and disinfect potentially contaminated body parts, especially hands and face, as well as clothing and equipment.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:04:12,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,docServ_self_protection,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,Service Documentation,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Service Documentation - Voltage Presence,563280,2.4,2.4.48.4.3.1.1,"Service DocumentsWARNINGCause: Even after switching off the power supply, electrical voltage is present in the system. Live-line working can cause electric shock or mechanical damage through short circuiting.Possible Consequences: Risk of death, serious physical injury or damage to property.Remedy: De-energize the system. If checks or measurements require live-line working, cover energized parts to prevent unintentional contact. Perform live-line working with extreme caution. Use only measurement equipment and devices which are suited to the task.Read and observe the warning labels attached next to conducting parts.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:04:51,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,docCS_voltage_presenence_xgen,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,Service Documentation,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Service Documentation ESU discharge,563284,2.4,2.4.48.4.3.2.1,"Service Safety Instruction WARNING Cause: If the ESU is not discharged completely, electrical voltage is present and is accessible when e. g. main unit covers are removed. Possible consequences: Risk of death or serious injury due to electric shock when electrified components are touched.Remedy: Discharge the ESU immediately after removing main unit covers before starting to work on relevant parts of the main unit, especially when removing or working on the ESU itself.If one of the fuses F21 or F20 is broken, the fast discharging procedure is not working. Verify that no voltage on the fuse holder is present before replacing broken fuses!",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:04:51,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,docCS_esu_discharge,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,Service Documentation,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

Live-line working can cause electric shock.  Possible consequences: Risk of death, serious physical injury or damage to property.  Remedy: Discharge the ESU prior to removing it.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:04:51,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,docSCM_esu_discharge,,,,,,Requirement,Basic,System Integration Test,EXPORT,Factory Documentation,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,Measure,NotForTC,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,Yes,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,
