PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Usability aspects,563370,3.1,2.4.51,"Inappropriate design of the user interface as well as adverse working situations can lead to intended or unintended use errors, causing hazards to persons and goods. E.g. risk of having certain parts of the user manual or user interface not in the users’ language.Risks related to usability are covered in above functional analysis, e. g. in <XREF>562462 </XREF>, <XREF>562202</XREF>, <XREF>562347</XREF>, <XREF>563480</XREF>.All usability relevant risk control measures are tagged with ""Usability: Yes"".",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:05:09,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,,,,,,,Headline,Basic,n.a.,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Warnings and cautions from supplied components,563369,4.0,2.4.52,"Safety information from the operator manual of suppliers' components, which are integrated into the medical system, has to be checked for applicability and adoption into the system operator manual.Risks related to supplied components are covered in above functional analysis.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2022-06-17  11:40:14,Johannes Schmidt,,,,,,,,Headline,Basic,n.a.,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Hazards to environment,563371,2.1,2.4.53,"Environmentally relevant risks, such as from emissions under normal use, radiation generation or leakage, or caused by the use of critical materials, or risks occurring during end of life treatment shall be considered in the scope of risk analysis. This risk analysis shall consider at least:• Material supply – starting with the obtaining of natural resources and ending with the supply of materials at the production site,• Production – covers manufacturing, including transportation and ends at handover of the product to the customer• Use – covers the use of the product including servicing• End of life – starts with the permanent taking out of service and de-installation of the product at the customer and ends with the supply of secondary material (material recycling), thermal recycling or disposal of non-recyclable substances. Risks related to the environment are covered in above functional analysis, e. g. in <XREF>563134</XREF>, <XREF>562094</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:05:09,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,,,,,,,Headline,Basic,n.a.,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Biological and chemical hazards,563372,2.1,2.4.54,"The devices must be designed and manufactured in such a way as to reduce to a minimum the risks posed by substances leaking from the device. Special attention shall be given to substances which are carcinogenic, mutagenic or toxic to reproduction (MDD).Biological and chemical risks are covered in above functional analysis, e. g. in <XREF>562010</XREF>, <XREF>563134</XREF>, <XREF>562094</XREF>.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:05:09,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,,,,,,,Headline,Basic,n.a.,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Hazards through outsourcing of processes,563373,1.4,2.4.55,"It must be evaluated, whether the outsourcing of the defined processes will introduce hazards to the product. These hazards can be related to e.g. inappropriate controlling of the supplier of outsourced processes.The wear and tear related hazards are managed by component design and their integration into the system according to the requirements about ""Service Life"" and the worst-case conditions within the scope of the intended use. The system level verification provides a confirmation for the fulfillment of wear and tear related requirements. Thereafter it is monitored throughout the entire product lifetime cycle by means of the CAPA process. Wear and tear related, potentially hazardous component failures are addressed in the system risk analysis in sections ""Evaluation of Functions, Hazards, Risks and Measures"".No risk on system level has been identified.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:04:03,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,,,,,,,Headline,Basic,n.a.,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Hazards by building services,563374,1.4,2.4.56,"It must be evaluated, whether effects from inappropriate building management services will introduce hazards to the manufacturing of the product. These effects may result through: e.g. temperature, pressure, humidity, pest infestation.No risk on system level has been identified.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:04:03,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,,,,,,,Headline,Basic,n.a.,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Hazards by environmental conditions during usage,563376,1.4,2.4.57,"It must be evaluated, whether the environmental conditions (as they are defined) will introduce hazards to the use of the product. These conditions are: temperature, pressure and humidity.No risk on system level has been identified.",Approved,Unassigned,Judith Welzel,Judith,Welzel,Judith Welzel,,,2020-07-29,2021-08-07  15:04:06,Yesin Gasmi (EXT),,,,,,,,Headline,Basic,n.a.,none,n.a.,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Hazard by to visual electromagnetic radiation,595404,2.3,2.4.58,"The system contains light sources (according to IEC 60601-1:2005 Clause 10.5 visual electromagnetic radiation) such as LEDs on UI devices like hand controls and control panels which are classified in the exempt group (Lamp does not pose any photobiological hazard) according to IEC 62471:2006. This is addressed in 06S434342 in 11108300-EPH-801. Therefore, no risk on system level has been identified.",Approved,Unassigned,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Johannes Schmidt,,,2022-03-23,2022-06-27  14:08:49,Johannes Schmidt,,,,,,,,Headline,Basic,n.a.,none,n.a.,Not Determined,empty,Not determined,,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,

PS_S1,Current Baseline,06H_Risk_Analysis (06H),Biocompatibility evaluation,597012,6.0,2.4.59,"Introduction IEC 60601-1, cl 11.7 and specifically ISO 10993-1 describe the general principles governing the biological evaluation of medical devices within a risk management framework, including the general categorization of devices based on the nature and duration of their contact with the body.The range of possible chemical and biological hazards is wide and can include short-term effects such as acute toxicity, irritation to the skin, eye and mucosal surfaces, haemolysis and thrombogenicity, as well as long-term or specific toxic effects such as subchronic and chronic toxic effects, sensitization resulting in allergy, genotoxicity, carcinogenicity (tumorigenicity) and effects on reproduction or development, including teratogenicity.Essential for the risk assessment of these hazards is to determine how critical are substances within the components and how likely it is that these substances are transferred to people to trigger a response.Note, the following evaluation is based on <XREF>347633</XREF>, specifically the guidance for biological evaluation of medical devices in acc. with ISO 10993-1. Overview and classification The <XREF>276902</XREF> describes the ""nature and duration of body contact"" for patients and users with the system. It is rated as a non-contacting medical device, because there is no direct contact between patient and the system required to fulfill the intended use. However, system contact is possible within the following situations:1. ""Intended"" short term (only seconds or minutes) contact (predominantly with the hand) with intact skin of qualified personnel (Manufacturing, Installation, Service, etc.) or the clinical personal at system control covers or control elements.2. Unintended (e.g. touched accidentally during a procedure) short term (only seconds or minutes) contact at the C-arm area with intact or non-intact skin of the patient. The CIOS systems are out of scope of ISO 10993-1 with the following rationales: Rationale and details for system operators System operators get in contact with user interfaces such as handles, control elements, PC-accessories or covers. These users are qualified manufacturing, installation, service or clinical personnel which are expected to have intact skin at their hands or are wearing gloves during work. Also the contact duration is very short-term considering the duration of contact categories in ISO 10993-1. Thus no detailed biological evaluation is needed for these components. However, in general it shall be shown that the materials of these components are in common use for other consumer products with a similar nature of contact, see <XREF>597019</XREF>.Furthermore, all the components are fulfilling applicable regulations (RoHS, REACH, etc.) which are restricting the use of substances of high concerns in medical devices and products. Rationale and details for patients The mobile C-arm systems are rated as non-contacting medical devices for patients. No direct or indirect contact is required to fulfill the intended use of the system. However, short-time contact is possible between patient skin (intact and in rate cases non-intact) and the C-arm area (C-Arm, detector cover and monobloc cover). Also it cannot be fully excluded that there might be a leakage of bodily fluids of the patient onto the above described system area. Therefore, this area specifically needs to be covered by sterile or sterilizable covers, see <XREF>562240</XREF>, effectively protecting the system and patient. Since there is no reasonably assumable contact between the patient and other parts of the device no further biological evaluation is needed.",Approved,Medium,Johannes Schmidt,Johannes,Schmidt,Johannes Schmidt,,,2022-06-27,2022-06-27  18:09:58,Johannes Schmidt,,,,,,,,Headline,Basic,n.a.,none,Factory Documentation,Not Determined,Not determined,Not determined,n.a.,TBD,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,NotDetermined,No,None,,,S1M,VB10,,,,,,,,,,,,,,NotDetermined,,,,
